testsuite.name: Boot
testsuite.details: create test suite for Boot module

testcase.name: Boot:Check binaries flashing on device
testcase.summary: Check flashing of binaries into DUT functionality.
testcase.preconditions:
1. ISO image should be available in pc for flashing.
2. Raven board with hard disk should be available.
3. “Unetbootin” tool should be available in PC.

step.actions:
1. Connect the USB storage drive in PC.
2. Open “Unetbootin “ tool.
3. Select “ISO” option under “Diskimage”  drop down box and select the “Diskimage” radio button.
4. Choose the ISO image from pc by browse and click on “OK” button. Once flashing done press on exit button.
5. Connect the USB flash drive to DUT USB port which is having the ISO image.
6. Power on the device, press on F12 button after power on the device.
7. Select the”Auto_Installation – Auto Install to specified harddisk” option.
8. Select the Installer source option which you want to install.
9. Select  the “Yes” button on “Auto Installer” dialog.
10. check whether installation is success or not.
step.expectedresults:
1. The “ISO” image should be flashed into expected USB storage.
2. Should be able to select the “Auto_Installation – Auto Install to specified harddisk” option.
3. Image should be flashed into DUT using Auto installer option on specified source.

testcase.name: Boot:Check device is booting to android screen
testcase.summary: Verify whether AMD Tambourine Platform is booting to its unlock screen or not..
testcase.preconditions: 1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues

step.actions:
1. Switch on the device by using power button.
2. Verify whether AMD Tambourine platform is able to boot completely to device unlock screen or not.
step.expectedresults: After switch on the Power button, the AMD Tambourine platform should be booting to its unlock screen without any issues.

testcase.name: Boot-Str:Check device is booting to android screen 25 times
testcase.summary: Verify whether AMD Tambourine Platform is booting to its unlock screen or not for 25 times.
testcase.preconditions: 1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues

step.actions:
1. Switch on the device by using power button.
2. Verify whether AMD Tambourine platform is able to boot completely to device unlock screen or not.
3. Repeat the above steps from 1 to 2 for 25 times.
step.expectedresults: For each iteration,After switch on the Power button, the AMD Tambourine platform should be booting to its unlock screen without any issues.

testcase.name: Boot:Check android animation logo
testcase.summary: Verify whether android animation logo is displaying or not
testcase.preconditions: 1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues

step.actions:
1. Switch on the device by using power button.
2. Wait for the device to boot up
3. While booting, check the display console for the boot Android animation logo whether it is clearly visible or not
step.expectedresults: While booting the device, the Boot Android animation logo should be shown on the display panel without any issues and also no artifacts should be observed.

testcase.name: Boot:Check device reboot with adb reboot command
testcase.summary: Verify whether Raven board is rebooting to android screen or not with “adb reboot” command
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues. 
2. Raven board should boot upto android.
3. Ethernet cable should be connected to device Ethernet port from PC

step.actions:
1. Connect the device to Ethernet IP address using the command “adb connect <IP address of the Ethernet cable>.
2. Enter the “adb reboot” command in PC terminal.
3.Check whether device is rebooting to android or not.
step.expectedresults:
1. After entering the “adb connect < ip address of the Ethernet>” then device should connected to that Ethernet IP address.
2. After entering the “adb reboot” command in pc terminal then device should restart and boot to android screen.

testcase.name: Boot:Check device keyboard and mouse functionality immediately after booting
testcase.summary: Check the DUT is supporting keyboard and mouse  interruptions or not
testcase.preconditions: 1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.

step.actions:
1. Switch on the device using power button.
2. Wait for the device to start bootup.
3. While booting try to select options using a keyboard.
4. Also try to select options using mouse while booting only.
5. After DUT gets booted try to operate keyboard.
6. Also try to operate DUT with mouse.
step.expectedresults:
1. The keyboard should work even during booting also.
2. The mouse should not work while booting.
3. The DUT should boot upto android screen without any issues.
4. After DUT gets booted the keyboard and mouse should work.

testcase.summary: Check the DUT is supporting  browsing after immediate boot or not
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Raven board should boot upto android unlock screen.
3. The DUT should be connected to WiFi or ethernet.

step.actions: 1. Immediately after the DUT showing android unlock screen , go to Browser->search and enter any URL like www.google.com.
step.expectedresults: 1. The google window should be displayed in the browser without any issues after immediate boot of the device.

testcase.name: Boot-Str:Check device reboot with adb reboot command for 25 times
testcase.summary: Check the DUT is rebooting to android scrren or not using “adb reboot” command for 25 times or not
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Raven board should boot upto android screen.
3. Ethernet cable should be connected to device Ethernet port from PC .

step.actions:
1. Connect the device to Ethernet IP address using the command “adb connect <IP address of the Ethernet cable>.
2. Enter the “adb reboot” command in PC terminal.
3. Check whether device is rebooting to android or not.
4. Repeat the steps fron 2 to 3 for 25 times.
step.expectedresults:
1. After entering the “adb connect < IP address of the Ethernet>” then device should connected to that Ethernet IP address.
2. After entering the “adb reboot” command in pc terminal then device should restart and boot to android screen for 25 times without any clashes.

testcase.name: Boot-Str:Check all apps are opening after boot the device 25 times
testcase.summary: Check the DUT is supporting all apps functioning after 25 times boot or not
testcase.preconditions: 1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues

step.actions:
1. Switch on the device by using power button.
2. Verify whether AMD Tambourine platform is able to boot completely to device unlock screen or not.
3. Repeat the above steps from 1 to 2 for 25 times.
4. Now,open camera.
5. Try to capture the image and then close the camera.
6. Now, open the notepad and write something.
7. Then close the notepad.
8. Now, open the browser and search for any URL.
9. After displaying the search result, close the browser.
10. Like this, open all the APK's supported by the DUT and check their functionality.
step.expectedresults:
1. For each iteration,After switch on the Power button, the AMD Tambourine platform should be booting to its unlock screen without any issues.
2. Image should be captured without any issues using camera.
3. While writing something into notepad all the keys in the keyboard should work properly without failing.
4. Similarly all the availble APK's in the device should work properly without any issues..

testcase.name: Boot-Conc:Check device is rebooting after poweroff
testcase.summary: Check whether device is re-booting properly or not after abruptly power off it.
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Raven board should boot upto android screen.
3. Ethernet cable should be connected to device Ethernet port from PC .

step.actions:
1. Switch on the device by using power button.
2. While booting, turn off the power button.
3. Immediately switch on the DUT and check whether device is booting or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. The DUT should boot upto android unlock screen without any issues even though is power off suddently while booting.

testcase.name: Boot-Conc:Check device is playing video while pushing files immediately after booting
testcase.summary: Check the DUT is supporting to play video streams after reboot the device (adb reboot) for 25 times while pushing files into DUT
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Raven board should boot upto android screen.
3. Ethernet cable should be connected to device Ethernet port from PC .

step.actions:
1. Connect the device to Ethernet IP address using the command “adb connect <IP address of the Ethernet cable>.
2. Enter the “adb reboot” command in PC terminal.
3. Check whether device is rebooting to android or not.
4. Repeat the steps 2 to 3 for 25 times.
5. Immediately, Go to browser and type Mp4 video download in search menu.
6. Click on any one of available links.
7. Click on any one of MP4 file you want to download.
8. Then click on download option showing there.
9. Connect the device to Ethernet IP address using the command “adb connect <IP address of the Ethernet cable>.
10. Enter the “adb push source path Destination path”.
11. Open Mxplayer.
12. Play any video file.
step.expectedresults:
1. The video should be played without any stability issues.
2. Search results should be displayed without buffering.
3. Download of file should be continued in the background.
4. The file which we are pushing should be available in the destination folder without any loss of data.

testsuite.name: Display
testsuite.details: Create test suite for display module

testcase.name: Display:Check DP detection
testcase.summary: Check DP is detected or not
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues. 
2. Raven board should boot upto android 
3. DP connection port should existed in the board.
4. DP display should connected to device DP port

step.actions: 1. Enter the command “ adb shell cat /sys/class/drm/card0-DP-1/status“ in pc terminal and check whether “connected” message is displaying or not. If  “connected” message is displayed then DP detected otherwise it is not detected.
step.expectedresults: 1. When the DP cable is connected the device and after entering the “ adb shell cat /sys/class/drm/card0-DP-1/status” command in PC terminal then “connected” message should be displayed.

testcase.name: Display:Check DP display
testcase.summary: Check DP display is coming or not after power on the device
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. DP connection port should be there on the board.

step.actions:
1.Connect the DP display to the device DP port.

2. Power on the device and check the display screen.
step.expectedresults: 1.Board should bootup properly with out any issues and there should not be screen corruptions or hangs. DP display screen should be shown properly without any issues.

testcase.name: Display:Check DP display after suspend/resume
testcase.summary: Check the DP Display after Suspend and Resume
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Raven board should boot upto android.
3. DP connecting cable should be connected to the board and DP display.

step.actions:
1.Connect the DP display to the board and then power on the board.
2. Check the display screen.
3. Disable the stay awake option in developer options.
4. Set the wake time in display to 15 seconds.
5.Suspend and resume the DUT then check the Display.
step.expectedresults: 1. Display screen should be shown properly without any issues.

testcase.name: Display:Check DP display hot-plug and hot-unplug
testcase.summary: Check the Hot-plug and Hot-unplug of the DP Display
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Raven board should boot upto android.
3. DP connecting cable should be connected to the board and DP display.

step.actions:
1.Connect the DP display to the board and then power on the board. Check the display screen.
2.Remove the DP cable on the board.
3.Connect the DP cable again to the board.
step.expectedresults:
1.Board should bootup properly with out any issues and there should not be screen corruptions or hangs.
2&3.Display should off after disconnecting the cable without any corruptions and display should shown properly after connecting the device again.

testcase.name: Display:Check display brightness
testcase.summary: Verify adjustment of display Brightness
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Raven board should boot upto android.
3. DP connecting cable should be connected to the board and DP display.

step.actions:
1. Go to Settings->Display settings -> Brightness.
2. Adjust the brightness to change the back-light.
3. Move the scroll bar to its completely minimum and maximum levels and observe the change in brightness.

testcase.name: Display:Check device detection of different resolutions
testcase.summary: Check whether DUT is detecting 1920x1080 and 1280x1080 resolution displays  or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Raven board should boot upto android.
3. DP connecting cable should be connected to the board and DP display.

step.actions:
1. Connect the DP display of resolution 1920x1080  to the board and then power on the board.
2. Check whether DUT  is detecting display resolution of 1920x1080.
3. Now connect DP display of resolution 1280x1080  to the board and then power on the board.
4. Check whether DUT  is detecting display resolution of 1280x1080.
step.expectedresults: 1. DUT  should detect display resolution of 1920x1080 and 1280x1080 connected to it and it should show properly without any issues i.e. corruptions.

testcase.name: Display:Check display size
testcase.summary: Check the display size using adb commands
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Raven board should boot upto android.
3. DP connecting cable should be connected to the board and DP display.

step.actions:
1.Connect the DP display to the board and then power on the board.
2. Check the display screen.
3. Check the display size using adb command 'adb shell wm size'.
step.expectedresults: 1.Display size should appear in command line.

testcase.name: Display:Check display density
testcase.summary: Check the display density using adb commands
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Raven board should boot upto android.
3. DP connecting cable should be connected to the board and DP display.

step.actions:
1. Connect the DP display to the board and then power on the board.
2. Check the display screen.
3. Check the display size using adb command 'adb shell wm density'.
step.expectedresults: 1.Display density should appear in command line.

testcase.name: Display:Check display size changing with adb commands
testcase.summary: Check if display size is changed with adb commands
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Raven board should boot upto android.
3. DP connecting cable should be connected to the board and DP display.

step.actions:
1. Connect the DP display to the board and then power on the board.
2. Check the display screen.
3. Check the display size using adb command 'adb shell wm size'.
4. Change the display size using adb command 'adb shell wm size 1280×800'.
5. Check whether the DUT display size is changed or not.
step.expectedresults: 1.Display size should change with the change display size command.

testcase.name: Display:Check display density changing with adb commands
testcase.summary: Check if display density is changed with adb commands
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Raven board should boot upto android.
3. DP connecting cable should be connected to the board and DP display.

step.actions:
1. Connect the DP display to the board and then power on the board.
2. Check the display screen.
3. Check the display density using adb command 'adb shell wm density'.
4. Change the display density using adb command 'adb shell wm density 390'.
5. Check whether the DUT display density is changed or not.
step.expectedresults: 1.Display density should change with the change display size command.

step.actions:

2.Change the Font size to small.
3. Check whether Font size of all the displayed text is reduced to small size or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. Font size of all the displayed text should be reduced to small size.

testcase.name: Display:Check display font changing to large
testcase.summary: Check whether Display Font size is changed to large

2. Raven board should boot upto android.

step.actions:

2.Change the Font size to large.

testcase.name: Display:Check display auto rotation

3. DP connecting cable should be connected to the board and DP display.

step.actions:

step.expectedresults: 1. Screen should automatically rotate when the device is rotated.

testcase.name: Display-Str:Check DP display Hot-plug and Hot-unplug for 25 times
testcase.summary: Check the Hot-plug and Hot-unplug of the DP Display 25 times
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Raven board should boot upto android.
3. DP connecting cable should be connected to the board and DP display.

step.actions:
1.Connect the DP display to the board and then power on the board. Check the display screen.
2.Remove the DP cable on the board.
3.Connect the DP cable again to the board.
4. Repeat 2 & 3 steps continously for 25 times and check the display.
step.expectedresults: 1. Display should off after disconnecting the cable without any corruptions and display should shown properly after connecting the device again for every iteration.

testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Raven board should boot upto android.
3. DP connecting cable should be connected to the board and DP display.

step.actions:
1. Connect the DP display to the board and then power on the board.
2. Check the display screen.
3. Disable the stay awake option in developer options.

5. Suspend and resume the DUT then check the Display.
6. Repeat 5th steps for 25 times and check the display.

testcase.summary: Check whether DUT is detecting 1920x1080 and 1280x1080 resolution displays  or not  with changing the resolution 25 times
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Raven board should boot upto android.
3. DP connecting cable should be connected to the board and DP display.

step.actions:
1.Connect the DP display of resolution 1920x1080  to the board and then power on the board.
2. Check whether DUT  is detecting display resolution of 1920x1080.
3.Now connect DP display of resolution 1280x1080  to the board and then power on the board.

testcase.name: Display-Str:Check DP display after reboot for 25 times
testcase.summary: Check the DP Display after reboot for 25 times
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Raven board should boot upto android.

1. Connect the DP display to the board and then power on the board. Check the display screen.
2. Reboot the device and check if the display is proper atfer rebooting the device.
3. Repeat 2nd step for 25 times and check if the display is proper atfer rebooting the device.
step.expectedresults: 1. The display should be proper without any issues and corruption, after rebooting the device for every iteration.

testcase.name: Display-Str:Check DP display size changing for 20 times
testcase.summary: Check changing resolution (display size) continously for 20 times
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Raven board should boot upto android.
3. DP connecting cable should be connected to the board and DP display.

step.actions:
1.Connect the DP display to the board and then power on the board.
2. Check the display screen.
3. Check the display size using adb command 'adb shell wm size'.
4. Change the display size using adb command 'adb shell wm size 1280×800'.
5. Check whether the DUT display size is changed or not.
6. Repeat the 4th step 20 times with different other resolutions and check whether the DUT display size is changed or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. Display size should change with the change display size command for differnet resolutions for every iteration.

4. Change the display density using adb command 'adb shell wm density 390'.

6. Repeat the 4th step 20 times with different other densities and check whether the DUT display size is changed or not .

testcase.name: Display-Conc:Check image opening in different densities
testcase.summary: Check image opening in different display densities
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Raven board should boot upto android.
3. DP connecting cable should be connected to the board and DP display.

step.actions:
1. Connect the DP display to the board and then power on the board.
2. Check the display screen.
3. Check the display density using adb command 'adb shell wm density'.
4. Change the display density using adb command 'adb shell wm density 390'.
5. Check whether the DUT display density is changed or not .
6. Open images in the gallery and check if images are displayed with the existing display density.
step.expectedresults: 1. Images should open with the existing display density.

testsuite.name: Ethernet
testsuite.details: Create test suite for Ethernet module

testcase.name: Ethernet:Check Ethernet detection
testcase.summary: Check the Ethernet detection functionality.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Ethernet cable should be available and it has Internet connection.
3. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
4. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.

step.actions: 1. Check whether Ethernet cable is detected or not by looking at the Ethernet port. If the cable is detected  then LED light will blink at the port.
step.expectedresults: The Ethernet cable should detect

testcase.name: Ethernet:Check Ethernet connection and disconnection
testcase.summary: Verify Ethernet Connect and Disconnect functionality
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Ethernet cable should be available and it has Internet connection.
3. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.

step.actions:
1. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.
2. Check whether Ethernet cable is detected or not by looking at the Ethernet port. If the cable is detected  then LED light will blink at the port. 
3. Disconnect Ethernet Cable from the Raven Board Ethernet port.
4. Check again whether the LED at Ethernet port is OFF or not.
5.Enter ifconfig command on the DUT after disconnection.
step.expectedresults:
1&2. The Ethernet cable should detect and LED should Blink/ON  when the Ethernet cable is connected to device Ethernet port and should able to ping "google.co.in successfully." 
 
3&4. The Ethernet LED should OFF when the Ethernet cable is disconnected from the Ethernet port.
5.IP address should not be configured to the DUT after disconnection of ethernet.

testcase.name: Ethernet-Str:Check Ethernet connection and disconnection 25 times
testcase.summary: Verify Ethernet Connect and Disconnect functionality 25 times
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Ethernet cable should be available and it has Internet connection.
3. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.

step.actions:
1. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.
2. Check whether Ethernet cable is detected or not by looking at the Ethernet port. If the cable is detected  then LED light will blink at the port. 
3. Disconnect Ethernet Cable from the Raven Board Ethernet port.
4. Check again whether the LED at Ethernet port is OFF or not.
5. Repeat the steps from 1 to 4 for 25 times.
step.expectedresults:
1&2. The Ethernet cable should detect and LED should Blink/ON  when the Ethernet cable is connected to device Ethernet port and should able to ping "google.co.in successfully." 
 
3&4. The Ethernet LED should OFF when the Ethernet cable is disconnected from the Ethernet port.

testcase.name: Ethernet:Check Ethernet after suspend/resume
testcase.summary: Verify Ethernet functionality after suspend/resume process is executed on the Device.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Ethernet cable should be available and it has Internet connection.
3. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.

step.actions:
1. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.
2. Check whether Ethernet cable is detected or not by looking at the Ethernet port. If the cable is detected  then LED light will blink at the port. 
3. Now, Short press the power button to Suspend the DUT
4. Wait for some time and let the device goes into sleep mode.
5. Press the power button again to resume the device from sleep mode
6. After Resuming, verify whether Ethernet cable is detected or not by looking at the Ethernet port.
step.expectedresults:
1&2. The Ethernet cable should detect and LED should Blink/ON  when the Ethernet cable is connected to device Ethernet port and should able to ping "google.co.in successfully." 
3&4.DUT should enter into sleep successfully without any issues.
5. After Resuming the device from suspend state, Ethernet cable should get detected and also should be able to browse internet without any issues.

testcase.name: Ethernet:Check Ethernet after power off/on
testcase.summary: Verify Ethernet functionality after power OFF and power ON the Device.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Ethernet cable should be available and it has Internet connection.
3. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.

step.actions:
1. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.
2. Check whether Ethernet cable is detected or not by looking at the Ethernet port. If the cable is detected  then LED light will blink at the port. 
3. Now, power OFF the DUT by using Raven Board power switch.
4. Power ON the DUT by using power switch.
5. Wait for some time for the device completely boots up to it's android screen.
6. After boots up, verify whether Ethernet cable is detected or not by looking at the Ethernet port.
step.expectedresults:
1&2. The Ethernet cable should detect and LED should Blink/ON  when the Ethernet cable is connected to device Ethernet port and should able to ping "google.co.in successfully." 
3.DUT should switch off successfully without any issues.
4,5&6. After Power on the device,Ethernet cable should get detected and also should be able to browse internet without any issues.

testcase.name: Ethernet:Check browsing with Ethernet
testcase.summary: Verify whether the system is able to browse with Ethernet
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Dynamic IP should configured to DUT.
3. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.

step.actions:
1. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.
2. Check whether Ethernet cable is detected or not by looking at the Ethernet port. If the cable is detected  then LED light will blink at the port. 
3. Open browser and try to access some web sites.
step.expectedresults:
1. Ethernet cable should detect when it is connected to device Ethernet port. 
2&3.System should be able to browse the internet without any issues

testcase.name: Ethernet:Check adb over Ethernet
testcase.summary: Verify whether the DUT support to adb over Ethernet functionality or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Ethernet cable should be available and it has Internet connection.
3. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
4. Should have Host PC.
5. should have the DUT IP Address

step.actions:
1. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.
2. Check whether Ethernet cable is detected or not by looking at the Ethernet port. If the cable is detected  then LED light will blink at the port. 
3. Open “Terminal Emulator” Apk on DUT.
4. Run “su” command on DUT terminal.
5. Run “setprop service.adb.tcp.port 5555” command on DUT terminal.
6. Run “stop adbd” command on DUT terminal.
7. Run “start adbd” command on DUT terminal.
8. Now open terminal in Host PC and Run “adb connect <DUT IP Address> ”.
9. Check whether the DUT is enumerated in PC or not by entering the  "adb devices" command in PC terminal.
step.expectedresults:
1. The Ethernet cable should detect and LED should Blink/ON  when the Ethernet cable is connected to device Ethernet port . 
2. The “adb connect <DUT IP Address>” command should show the “Connected to <DUT IP Address>”
3. The DUT should show under the “adb devices” list.

testcase.name: Ethernet:Check download a file with Ethernet
testcase.summary: Verify whether the DUT is able to download a file with Ethernet network.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Ethernet cable should be available and it has Internet connection.
3. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.

step.actions:
1. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.
2. Check whether Ethernet cable is detected or not by looking at the Ethernet port. If the cable is detected  then LED light will blink at the port. 
3.. Open browser and try to download any file from internet.
step.expectedresults:
1. Ethernet cable should detect when it is connected to device Ethernet port. 
2&3.System should be able to download a file with Ethernet(some valid websites) without any issues.

testcase.name: Ethernet:Check device re-enumeration after power off/on
testcase.summary: Verify whether the DUT able to re-enumerate after Power OFF and ON or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Ethernet cable should be available and it has Internet connection.
3. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
4. Should have Host PC.
5. should have the DUT IP Address

step.actions:
1. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.
2. Check whether Ethernet cable is detected or not by looking at the Ethernet port. If the cable is detected  then LED light will blink at the port. 
3. Open “Terminal Emulator” Apk on DUT.
4. Run “su” command on DUT terminal.
5. Run “setprop service.adb.tcp.port 5555” command on DUT terminal.
6. Run “stop adbd” command on DUT terminal.
7. Run “start adbd” command on DUT terminal.
8. Now open terminal in Host PC and Run “adb connect <DUT IP Address> ”.
9. Check whether the DUT is enumerated in PC or not by entering the  "adb devices" command in PC terminal.
10. Power OFF the DUT by power switch.
11. Power ON the DUT by power switch.
12. Wait for some time for the device completely boots up to it's android screen.
13. After Boots up the DUT, repeat the above steps 8 and 9.
step.expectedresults:
1. The Ethernet cable should detect and LED should Blink/ON  when the Ethernet cable is connected to device Ethernet port . 
2. The “adb connect <DUT IP Address>” command should show the “Connected to <DUT IP Address>”
3. The DUT should show under the “adb devices” list.
4. After reboot also, the DUT should show under the “adb devices” list.

testcase.name: Ethernet:Check adb commands over Ethernet
testcase.summary: Verify the adb commands(DUT connected over ethernet) functionality i.e. adb push, adb pull and adb install
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Ethernet cable should be available and it has Internet connection.
3. Connect the Device to host over the Ethernet.

step.actions: 1. Run the ADB commands like adb pull and push,adb install, adb logcat etc., commands in the host.
step.expectedresults: 1.All the ADB commands should work properly without any issues.

testcase.name: Ethernet:Check downloading of large file with Ethernet
testcase.summary: Verify whether the DUT is able to download large size  files with Ethernet network or not.
testcase.preconditions:

3. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.

step.actions:
1. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.

step.expectedresults:
1. Ethernet cable should detect when it is connected to device Ethernet port. 
2&3.System should be able to download large size files file with Ethernet without any issues.

testcase.name: Ethernet:Check Ethernet IPV4
testcase.summary: Verify whether Ethernet is supporting IPV4 or not
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Ethernet cable should be there and it has Internet connection.
3. Boot the device completely to its unlock screen.

step.actions:
1. Connect the Ethernet cable which is having the static IP address to the device Ethernet port.
2. Open the network info app, click on Get IP
3. Observe the external IP address in the device
step.expectedresults: 1. Ethernet should be able to get detected and the IPV4 address will be same as original ethernet cable address

testcase.name: Ethernet:Check Ethernet IPV6
testcase.summary: Verify whether Ethernet is supporting IPV6 or not

testcase.name: Ethernet:Check Ethernet speed
testcase.summary: Check Ethernet speed
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Ethernet cable should be there and it has Internet connection.
3. Boot the device completely to its unlock screen.
4. WiFi  router should be available and it has internet connection.

step.actions:
1. Set the WiFi router net-speed to 10Mbps and 100Mbps.
2. Connect the Ethernet cable from WiFi router to Device Ethernet Port.
3. Check whether Ethernet cable is detected or not by looking at the Ethernet port. If the cable is detected then LED light will blink at the port. 
4. Open the browser.
5. Open the speed test and check the internet speed is same as set in wifi router.
step.expectedresults:
1. After connecting the Ethernet cable to device, the Ethernet cable should be detected 
2. In the browser, speed test should show the same internet speed which is set in the wifi router.

testcase.name: Ethernet:Check data loss using ping command
testcase.summary: Verify data loss using ping command on local networks(In progress)
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2. Connected router should have Internet.

step.actions:
1. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.
2. Check whether Ethernet cable is detected or not by looking at the Ethernet port. If the cable is detected  then LED light will blink at the port.
3. Ping ip address of local network ex- ping 10.50.75.177  in command line and press ctrl+c after 10 seconds and check whether any data loss is there
step.expectedresults: 1. No data loss should be there when ping command is used.

testcase.name: Ethernet:Check data loss using ping flood command
testcase.summary: Verify data loss using ping flood command on local networks
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2. Connected router should have Internet.

step.actions:
1. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.
2. Check whether Ethernet cable is detected or not by looking at the Ethernet port. If the cable is detected  then LED light will blink at the port.
3. Ping flood ip address of local network ex- ping -f 10.50.75.177  in command line and press ctrl+c after 10 seconds and check whether any data loss is there.
step.expectedresults: 1. No data loss should be there when ping flood command is used.

testcase.name: Ethernet:Check Ethernet priority when compared wifi
testcase.summary: Verify Ethernet is given high priority than WiFi or not
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Ethernet cable should be there and it has Internet connection.
3. Boot the device completely to its unlock screen.
4. Install network info app in the device.

step.actions:
1. Go to settings → Enable WiFi and connect to router.
2. Connect the Ethernet cable which is having internet.
3. Verify whether WiFi is got disconnected or not.
4. Now disconnect the Ethernet cable from device and check whether WiFi is automatically connected to previously connected APN.
step.expectedresults:
1. When Ethernet cable connected to device then WiFi should be disconnect because Ethernet is high priority than WiFi.
2. When Ethernet  is disconnect from the device then WiFi should be automatically connected to previously connected APN.

testcase.name: Ethernet-Neg:Check ethernet connection when fault in cable
testcase.summary: Verify ethernet connection when ethernet cable is not working
testcase.preconditions:

step.actions:

2. Check whether Ethernet cable is detected or not by looking at the Ethernet port. If the cable is detected  then LED light will blink at the port.
step.expectedresults: 1. Ethernet should not be detected as the cable is non functional.

testcase.name: Ethernet-Str:Check Ethernet connection after 25 times suspend/resume

testcase.name: Ethernet-Conc:Check file transfer while ethernet(Connect/Disconnect)

6. Disconnect and connect back ethernet connection and observe its behavior.
step.expectedresults: 1. Files should be transferred and should not be effected by ethernet connection/disconnection.

testcase.name: Ethernet-Conc:Check ethernet connection while browsing and airplane mode(On/Off)

testcase.name: Ethernet-Conc:Check audio/video streaming on USB/BT headset

testcase.name: Ethernet-Conc:Check adb push/pull with suspend and resume
testcase.summary: Verify adb push/pull with suspend and resume functionality
testcase.preconditions:

step.expectedresults: 1. Files should not be pushed when device goes to suspend state.

testsuite.name: USB
testsuite.details: Create test suite for USB host mode

testcase.name: USB:Check USB Keyboard detection
testcase.summary: Check the USB Keyboard Functionality
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. USB should work as a host.

step.actions:
1.Connect the USB Keyboard to USB port on the device and then power on the System.
2.Press F12 or DEL to enter into BIOS settings/Boot Menu.
3.After bootup,Open any notepad kind of application and enter all the keys,check the functionality.
step.expectedresults:
1. USB should detect properly without any issues.
2.Keyboard should work properly without any issues and system should enter into BIOS/BootMenu.
3.All keys in the Keyboard should work properly without any issues.

testcase.name: USB:Check USB Mouse detection

testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.

step.actions:

2.Press F12 or DEL to enter into BIOS settings/Boot Menu.
3.After bootup,Use mouse options(Leftclick and Right click ,etc.,) to open application and perform actions.
step.expectedresults:
1. USB should detect properly without any issues.
2.Keyboard And Mouse should work properly without any issues.
3.Mouse functionality should work properly without any issues.

testcase.name: USB:Check USB storage detection

2. Go to settings -> Storage -> USB disk.
3. Now check whether USB 2.0 flash device is detected or not with out any issues. .
step.expectedresults: 1. USB Storage should detect in USB host port and also device display screen should not rotate when the USB 2.0 devices connected to host port.USb storage device data should display properly without any issues.

testcase.name: USB:Check USB detection after suspend/resume

1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
4. USB should work as a host.

step.actions:

3.Check the USB Keyboard,mouse and storage device functionality on the Platform.
step.expectedresults:
1.USB Keyboard,Mouse and storage device should detect properly without any issues.
2.DUT should enter into the sleep mode and resume properly without any issues.
3.All USB devices should be functional with out any issues.

testcase.name: USB:Check USB detection in all 4 ports

testcase.name: USB-Neg:Check USB detection when USB drive is not working

3. Check if device is detected or not.
step.expectedresults: USB should not be detected as USB drive is non functional

testcase.name: USB-Conc:Check accessing and playing audio/video from USB
testcase.summary: Verify file accessing and playing audio/video from USB
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. USB should work as a host.

step.actions:
1. Connect a USB storage device (e.g.: USB 2.0/3.0 Flash device/Pen drives) with media files to USB host port.
2. Go to settings -> Storage -> USB disk.
3. Now check whether USB 2.0 flash device is detected or not with out any issues.
4. Try to access the media files from the pen drive and play audio or video files.
step.expectedresults:
1. Files should be accesible from USB.
2. Audio/Video files should play from USB.

testcase.name: USB-Conc:Check file accessing and playing from USB simultaneously opening DUT gallery
testcase.summary: Verify file accessing and playing audio from USB and simultaneusly opening DUT Gallery contents
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. USB should work as a host.

step.actions:
1. Connect a USB storage device (e.g.: USB 2.0/3.0 Flash device/Pen drives) with media files to USB host port.
2. Go to settings -> Storage -> USB disk.
3. Now check whether USB 2.0 flash device is detected or not with out any issues.
4. Try to play audio from pendrive and open the Gallery contents of the device.
step.expectedresults: 1. Gallery contents should open and audio should be playing from USB in background.

testcase.name: USB-Conc:Check USB connection with suspend and resume
testcase.summary: USB  connect and disconnect with Suspend and resume
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. USB should work as a host.

step.actions:
1. Connect a USB storage device (e.g.: USB 2.0/3.0 Flash device/Pen drives) with media files to USB host port.
2. Go to settings -> Storage -> USB disk.
3. Now check whether USB 2.0 flash device is detected or not with out any issues.
4. Disable the stay awake option in developer options.
5. Set the wake time in display to 15 seconds.
6.Suspend and resume the DUT then check whether USB is connected.
7.Remove USB and suspend and resume the DUT ,then check whether USB is disconnected.
step.expectedresults:
1. USB should be connected after suspend and resume when USB is actually connected.
2. USB should be disconnected after suspend and resume when USB is removed.

testcase.name: USB-Conc:Check USB by connecting to DUT play media and remove inbetween
testcase.summary: USB pen drive connect , play media and remove pendrive in between
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. USB should work as a host.

step.actions:
1. Connect a USB storage device (e.g.: USB 2.0/3.0 Flash device/Pen drives) with media files to USB host port.
2. Go to settings -> Storage -> USB disk.
3. Now check whether USB 2.0 flash device is detected or not with out any issues.
4. Try to access the media files from the pen drive and play audio or video files.
5.Remove the pendrive and check if media has stopped playing.
step.expectedresults: 1. Audio/Video files should play from USB when connected and should not play when removed.

testcase.name: USB-Conc:Check USB to play media through BT speakers while using adb push/pull
testcase.summary: Verify Push/Pull functionality and play media from USB through BT speakers
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. USB should work as a host.

step.actions:
1.Push some audio/video/image files to the device using ethernet.
2. Connect a USB storage device (e.g.: USB .0/3.0 Flash device/Pen drives) with media files to USB host port.
3. Go to settings -> Storage -> USB disk.
4. Now check whether USB 2.0 flash device is detected or not with out any issues.Connect BT headset to the device.
5. Try to access the media files from the pen drive and play audio or video files from USB using BT speakers.
step.expectedresults: 1. Audio/video files from usb should be playing through BT speakers.

testcase.name: USB-Conc:Check media play from USB through BT speakers while downloading file
testcase.summary: Verify Push/Pull functionality and play media from USB trough BT speakers ,when downloading file is in progress
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. USB should work as a host.

step.actions:
1.Push some audio/video/image files to the device using ethernet
2. Connect a USB storage device (e.g.: USB .0/3.0 Flash device/Pen drives) with media files to USB host port.
3. Go to settings -> Storage -> USB disk.
4. Now check whether USB 2.0 flash device is detected or not with out any issues.Connect BT headset to the device.
5.Download some large files from website.
6. Try to access the media files from the pen drive and play audio or video files from USB using BT speakers when downloading is in progress.
step.expectedresults: 1. Audio/video files from usb should be playing through BT speakers while downloading is in progress.

testcase.name: USB-Conc:Check media access through USB while alarm is set
testcase.summary: Verify media access functionality when alarm is set
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. USB should work as a host.

step.actions:
1.Go to settings and set an alarm in 3 minutes and connect a USB storage device (e.g.: USB 2.0/3.0 Flash device/Pen drives) with media files to USB host port.
2. Go to settings -> Storage -> USB disk.
3. Now check whether USB 2.0 flash device is detected or not with out any issues.
4. Try to access the media files from the pen drive and play audio or video files for 3 minutes and check if media is playing without getting effected from alarms.
step.expectedresults: 1. Audio and video should be played without getting effected by alarms.

testsuite.name: WiFi
testsuite.details: Create test suite for WiFi module

testcase.name: WiFi:Check WiFi option enable/disable
testcase.summary: Verify WiFi option enabling/disabling functionality
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Wi-Fi functionality should be supported in the build
3. WiFi module should be present on device.

step.actions:
1. Go to Settings->Wireless & networks->Wi-Fi settings
2. Enable WiFi option and verify whether WiFi option is ON or not.
3. Disable WiFi option and check whether WiFi is OFF or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. WiFi should be ON when WiFi option is checked and WiFi should be off when the WiFi option is unchecked.

testcase.name: WiFi:Check WiFi scan functionality
testcase.summary: Verify whether device is able to scan and show all the available supported WiFi frequency networks or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Wi-Fi functionality should be supported in the build
3. WiFi module should be present on device.

step.actions:
1. Enable Wi-Fi option on DUT
2. Verify whether Wi-Fi is able to scan and show all the supported frequency bands available networks when the WiFi option is enabled.
step.expectedresults: 1. Wi-Fi should scan and show all the supported frequency bands available networks when the WiFi option is enabled.

testcase.name: WiFi:Check browse with WiFi
testcase.summary: Verify whether tester is able to browse on the target DUT using the WiFi network or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Wi-Fi functionality should be supported in the build
3. WiFi module should be present on device.
4. Connected router should have Internet.

step.actions:
1. Go to Settings->Wireless & networks->Wi-Fi settings
2. Check Wi-Fi option and wait for few seconds.
3. Verify whether WiFi is ON , and let the DUT find out all available APs or not.
4. Connect to the known router by providing proper authentication
5. Open browser app, type any URL and start browsing
step.expectedresults: 1. WiFi option should be enabled after selecting the option and WiFi should be connected to the known network after providing the credentials. The DUT should be able to access all available websites in the browser.

testcase.name: WiFi:Check WiFi is supporting WPA2 security protocol
testcase.summary: Verify Wi-Fi connect with WPA2 security enabled
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Wi-Fi functionality should be supported by the build
3. WiFi module should be present on device.

step.actions:
1. Switch on the Wi-Fi Router
2. Enable 802.11 b/g/n auto mode.
3. Set the router security mode as WPA and also set the router password and save the router settings.
4. Enable Wi-Fi on DUT
5. Scan for routers available in the vicinity
6. Connect to the known router by providing proper authentication of WPA2
step.expectedresults: WiFi  should connect to the WPA2 security  router and signal strength should be shown on DUT

testcase.name: WiFi-Str:Check WiFi option enable/disable 25 times
testcase.summary: Verify WiFi option enabling/disabling functionality 25 times
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Wi-Fi functionality should be supported in the build
3. WiFi module should be present on device.
4. Connected router should have Internet.

step.actions:
1. Go to Settings->Wireless & networks->Wi-Fi settings
2. Enable WiFi option and verify whether WiFi option is ON or not.
3. Disable WiFi option and check whether WiFi is OFF or not.                                                                4. Repeat this step for multiple times 25 times and check whether WIFI is becoming ON/OFF based on WIFI enabled/disabled
step.expectedresults:
For each iteration:
WiFi should be ON when WiFi option is checked and WiFi should be off when the WiFi option is unchecked.

testcase.name: WiFi:Check WiFi option connect and disconnect with APN
testcase.summary: Verify WiFi option disconnect and connect to other WIFI network
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Wi-Fi functionality should be supported in the build
3. WiFi module should be present on device.
4. Connected router should have Internet.

step.actions:
1. Go to Settings->Wireless & networks->Wi-Fi settings
2. Enable WiFi option and verify whether WiFi option is ON or not.                                                  3.Check whether WiFi listed all the available WiFi networks 
4. Connect to  a WiFi network by providing proper authentication.
5. Disconnect the WiFi network and connect to some other WiFi network
step.expectedresults: After disconnected the WiFi from APN, WiFi should be able to connect other APN.

testcase.name: WiFi:Check WiFi browsing when APN has connected with many devices
testcase.summary: Verify whether DUT is able to browse when many devices are connected to the same WiFi
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Wi-Fi functionality should be supported in the build
3. WiFi module should be present on device.
4. Connected router should have Internet.

step.actions:
1.Go to Settings->More->Aeroplane mode and enable aeroplane mode                                         2. Go to Settings->Wireless & networks->Wi-Fi settings
3. Enable WiFi option and verify whether WiFi option is ON or not.                                                   4.Check whether WiFi listed all the available WiFi networks 
5. Connect to  a WiFi network by proving proper authentication                                                            6.Connect many other devices to the same WiFi network                                                           6.Check whether DUT is able to browse any URL in Browser app without any issue in connectivity speed
step.expectedresults: The DUT should be able to accessed browse the websites without issue in connectivity speed

testcase.name: WiFi:Check WiFi connection when it is in beyond the APN range
testcase.summary: Verify whether DUT is not able to connect WiFi when the router is placed beyond its range
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Wi-Fi functionality should be supported in the build
3. WiFi module should be present on device.
4. Connected router should have Internet.

step.actions:
1.Go to Settings->More->Aeroplane mode and enable aeroplane mode                                         2. Go to Settings->Wireless & networks->Wi-Fi settings
3. Enable WiFi option and verify whether WiFi option is ON or not.                                                   4.Check whether WiFi listed the network for the router which was moved beyond its range
step.expectedresults: DUT should not able to connect WiFi when the router is placed beyond its range

testcase.name: WiFi:Check able to download a file with WiFi network
testcase.summary: Verify Downloading functionality when WiFi is connected
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Wi-Fi functionality should be supported in the build
3. WiFi module should be present on device.
4. Connected router should have Internet.

step.actions:
1. Go to Settings->Wireless & networks->Wi-Fi settings
2. Enable WiFi option and verify whether WiFi option is ON or not.                                                3.Check whether WiFi listed all the available WiFi networks.
4. Connect to  a WiFi network by proving proper authentication.                                                            5.Check whether the device is able to browse any URL in Browser app.                                        6.Try to download any files from internet.
step.expectedresults: Files should be downloaded when WiFi is connected

testcase.name: WiFi:Check able to download large file with WiFi network
testcase.summary: Verify Downloading large files functionality when WiFi is connected
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Wi-Fi functionality should be supported in the build
3. WiFi module should be present on device.
4. Connected router should have Internet.

step.actions:
1. Go to Settings->Wireless & networks->Wi-Fi settings
2. Enable WiFi option and verify whether WiFi option is ON or not.                                                   3.Check whether WiFi listed all the available WiFi networks 
4. Connect to  a WiFi network by proving proper authentication                                                             5.Check whether the device is able to browse any URL in Browser app.                                         6.Try to download large files  (5-10GB) from internet
step.expectedresults: Files should be downloaded when WiFi is connected

testcase.name: WiFi:Check WiFi network is supporting B,G,N modes
testcase.summary: Verify whether WiFi is supporting B,G and N Network Modes or not
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Wi-Fi functionality should be supported in the build
3. WiFi module should be present on device.

step.actions:
1. Switch on the Wi-Fi Router
 
"Wireless-B only" mode 
2. Go to Router's Wireless settings and change the Network mode to "Wireless-B only" mode and 
3. Enable Wi-Fi on DUT
4. Scan for routers available in the vicinity
5. Connect to the known router by providing proper authentication of WPA2
 
"Wireless-G only" mode :
6. Go to Router's Wireless settings and change the Network mode to "Wireless-G only" mode
7. Repeat the steps from 3 to 5
 
"Wireless-B/G only" mode: 
8. Go to Router's Wireless settings and change the Network mode to "Wireless-B/G only" mode
9. Repeat the steps from 3 to 5
 
"Wireless-N only" mode: 
10. Go to Router's Wireless settings and change the Network mode to "Wireless-N only" mode
11. Repeat the steps from 3 to 5
12. Verify whether WiFi is automatically disconnected and re-connected whenever router modes get changed.
step.expectedresults:
1. Wi-Fi connection should be established to router and signal strength should be shown on DUT. Device should be compatible and work in all the B,G and N modes without any issues. 
2. Wi-Fi should automatically disconnect and re-connect whenever router modes get changed.

testcase.name: WiFi:Check WiFi supports WEP security protocol
testcase.summary: Verify Wi-Fi connect with WEP security enabled
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Wi-Fi functionality should be supported in the build
3. WiFi module should be present on device.

step.actions:
1. Switch on the Wi-Fi  Router
2. Enable 802.11 b/g/n auto mode
3. Select security mode as WEP.
4. Select Encryption option as 64bit.
5. Enter 10digit hexadecimal value in Key column and save the settings.
6. Enable Wi-Fi on DUT
7. Scan for routers available in the vicinity
8. Connect to the known router by providing proper authentication of WEP i.e., Key value
step.expectedresults:
1. Connection should be established to router and signal strength should be shown on DUT.
2. Security mode should be shown on network under Wi-Fi settings.

testcase.name: WiFi:Check WiFi supports WPA security protocol
testcase.summary: Verify Wi-Fi connect with WPA security enabled
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Wi-Fi functionality should be supported in the build
3. WiFi module should be present on device.

step.actions:
1. Switch on the Wi-Fi Router
2. Enable 802.11 b/g/n auto mode.
3. Set the router security mode as WPA and also set the router password and save the router settings.
4. Enable Wi-Fi on DUT
5. Scan for routers available in the vicinity
6. Connect to the known router by providing proper authentication of WPA
step.expectedresults: WiFi should connect to the WPA security router and signal strength should be shown on DUT

testcase.name: WiFi:Check WiFi is auto connected to previously established network after restart
testcase.summary: Verify Wi-Fi auto connect  to the previously established network after DUT is re-started
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Wi-Fi functionality should be supported in the build
3. WiFi module should be present on device.

step.actions:
1. Switch on the Wi-Fi Router
2. Enable 802.11 b/g/n auto mode
3. Enable Wi-Fi on DUT
4.  Scan for routers available in the vicinity
5.  Connect to the known router by providing proper authentication
6. Restart the target. Wait until the device booting upto unlock screen.
7. Verify whether Wi-Fi is connected to previously established router automatically  or not.
step.expectedresults: Wi-Fi should automatically be connected to previously established network after re-starting the device and signal strength should be shown on DUT

testcase.name: WiFi:Check WiFi is reconnected to the remembered network
testcase.summary: Verify whether WiFi is automatically re-connecting to the remembered network when the WIFi is in enabled state.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Wi-Fi functionality should be supported in the build
3. WiFi module should be present on device.

step.actions:
1. Enable Wi-Fi on DUT
2.  Scan for routers available in the vicinity area of the device
3.  Connect to the known router by providing proper authentication.
4. Now disable the WiFi option from the WIRELESS & NETWORKS settings.
5. Now try to turn the WiFi from the WIRELESS & NETWORKS settings
6. Verify whether Wi-Fi is connected to previously established router automatically  or not.
step.expectedresults: WiFi should automatically re-connect to the remembered network when the WIFi is in enabled state.

testcase.name: WiFi:Check WiFi auto connection when moving from non-coverage area to signal area
testcase.summary: Verify Auto Connect to the router on moving from No-Coverage area to signal area
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Wi-Fi should be enabled in the build
3. Boot up should not have any issues

step.actions:
1. Enable Wi-Fi on DUT
2. Scan for routers available in the vicinity area of the device
3. Connect to the known router by providing proper authentication
4. Keep moving away from the router until device reaches WiFi disconnected area.
5. Now return back to the router vicinity area and check whether wifi is auto connected to the router or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. Device should be Auto Connected to the router on moving from No-Coverage area to signal area

testcase.name: WiFi:Check file downloading while Wifi is disabled
testcase.summary: Verify Downloading functionality when WiFi is connected
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2. Wi-Fi functionality should be supported in the build.
3. WiFi module should be present on device.
4. Connected router should have Internet.

step.actions:
1. Go to Settings->Wireless & networks->Wi-Fi settings
2. Enable WiFi option and verify whether WiFi option is ON or not.
3. Check whether WiFi listed all the available WiFi networks.
4. Connect to  a WiFi network by proving proper authentication.
5. Check whether the device is able to browse any URL in Browser app.
6. Disable WiFi in the Settings.
7. Try to download any files from internet.
step.expectedresults: 1. Files should not be downloaded when WiFi is disabled.

testcase.name: WiFi:Check WiFi browsing using URL's
testcase.summary: Verify whether the DUT is able to browse web sites using URL's or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android Main menu.
2. The  DUT should have the internet facility (Wi-Fi / 3G / Ethernet).

step.actions:
1.Open the Browser Apk,
2. Open the “www.msn.com” URL.
3. Check whether the MSN website open or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. The DUT should be able to browse web sites using URL's and able to access the “www.msn.com” website.

testcase.name: WiFi:Check audio streaming through WiFi
testcase.summary: Verify whether the DUT is able to play streaming audio or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android Main menu.
2. The  DUT should have the internet facility (Wi-Fi / 3G / Ethernet).

step.actions:
1.Open the Browser Apk.
2. Open the “https://gaana.com/” URL.
3. Play any Audio.
4. Check whether the Audio is playing without any issues or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. The DUT should be able to play streaming audio with out any issues.

testcase.name: WiFi:Check video streaming through WiFi
testcase.summary: Verify whether the DUT is able to play streaming video or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android Main menu.
2. The  DUT should have the internet facility (Wi-Fi / 3G / Ethernet).

step.actions:
1.Open the Browser Apk.
2. Open the “https://m.youtube.com” URL.
3. Play any Video.
4. Check whether the video is playing without any issues or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. The DUT should be able to play streaming video with out any issues.

testcase.name: WiFi:Check network time through WiFi
testcase.summary: Verify whether the DUT is able to get network time or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android Main menu.
2. The  DUT should have the internet facility (Wi-Fi / 3G / Ethernet).

step.actions:
1. Disable the WiFi/3G/Ethernet options.
2. Go to Settings → Date & time.
3. Disable the “Automatic date & time” and set the incorrect time in the device.
4. Enable the WiFi/3G/Ethernet in the device.
5. Enable the “Automatic date & time” option under “Date & time” settings.
6. Check whether correct time is showing by the device or not by using the network.
step.expectedresults: 1. The DUT should be updated to correct time using network when the device has incorrect time.

testcase.name: WiFi:Check by disconnecting and connecting WiFi network during file download
testcase.summary: Verify disconnect and connect back the WiFi network during downloading files
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android Main menu.
2. The  DUT should have the internet facility (Wi-Fi / 3G / Ethernet).

step.actions:
1. Go to Settings->Wireless & networks->Wi-Fi settings
2. Enable WiFi option and verify whether WiFi option is ON or not.
3. Check whether WiFi listed all the available WiFi networks
4. Connect to  a WiFi network by proving proper authentication.
5. Check whether the device is able to browse any URL in Browser app.
6. Try to download any files from internet
7. Disconnect the WiFi network in between anc connect back again.
8. Observe the files downloading.
step.expectedresults: 1. Files should resume downloading when Wifi is connected again.

testcase.name: WiFi:Check data loss using ping command

2. Wi-Fi functionality should be supported in the build.
3. WiFi module should be present on device.
4. Connected router should have Internet.

step.actions:

2. Enable WiFi option and verify whether WiFi option is ON or not.
3. Check whether WiFi listed all the available WiFi networks
4. Connect to  a WiFi network by proving proper authentication.
5. Ping ip address of local network ex- ping 10.50.75.177  in command line and press ctrl+c after 10 seconds and check whether any data loss is there.
step.expectedresults: 1. No data loss should be there when ping command is used.

testcase.name: WiFi:Check data loss using ping flood command

4. Connect to  a WiFi network by proving proper authentication.

1. Go to Settings->Wireless & networks->Wi-Fi settings.

3. Set the channel as 40 Mhz.
4. Observe its performance and reliability.
step.expectedresults: 1. 40MHz or 80 Mhz channels in the 5 Ghz is supported.

testcase.name: WiFi-Neg:Check WiFi to connect a network without password
testcase.summary: Verify trying connecting to a WiFi network without password
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2. Wi-Fi functionality should be supported in the build.
3. WiFi module should be present on device.

step.actions:
1. Go to Settings->Wireless & networks->Wi-Fi settings.
2. Check Wi-Fi option and wait for few seconds.
3. Verify whether WiFi is ON , and let the DUT find out all available APs or not.
4. Try connecting to the network without  providing any authorization.
step.expectedresults: 1. Wifi should not be connected to the network with out providing authorization.

3. Verify whether WiFi is ON , and let the DUT find out all available APs or not.
4. Try connecting to the network which has no password restriction.
step.expectedresults: 1. WiFi should be connected without any issues.

3. Verify whether WiFi is ON , and let the DUT find out all available APs or not.
4. Check whether any APNs are listed or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. APNs should not be displayed as WiFi module is removed.

testcase.name: WiFi-Str:Check WiFi to connect and disconnect for 25 times
testcase.summary: Verify WiFi option enabling/disabling functionality 25 times
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2. Wi-Fi functionality should be supported in the build.
3. WiFi module should be present on device.
4. Connected router should have Internet.

step.actions:
1. Go to Settings->Wireless & networks->Wi-Fi settings.
2. Enable WiFi option and verify whether WiFi option is ON or not.
3. Disable WiFi option and check whether WiFi is OFF or not.
4. Repeat this step for multiple times 25 times and check whether WIFI is becoming ON/OFF based on WIFI enabled/disabled.
step.expectedresults:
For each iteration:
1. WiFi should be ON when WiFi option is checked and WiFi should be off when the WiFi option is unchecked.

testcase.name: WiFi-Conc:Check BT on/off while downloading files using WiFi

step.actions:

3. Check whether WiFi listed all the available WiFi networks.
4. Connect to  a WiFi network by proving proper authentication.
5. Check whether the device is able to browse any URL in Browser app.
6. Try to download any files from internet.
7. Enable and disable BT during downloading files.
step.expectedresults: 1. All the files should be downloaded and BT on/off should not effect downloading.

5. Enable and disable airplane mode during downloading files.
step.expectedresults: 1. All the files should be downloaded and airplane mode on/off should not effect downloading.

testcase.name: WiFi-Conc:Check video streaming during WiFi or Ethernet in (on/off)

testcase.name: WiFi-Conc:Check WiFi browsing when alarm is set
testcase.summary: Verify WiFi Browsing functionality when alarm is set

4. Connect to  a WiFi network by proving proper authentication.
5.Check whether the device is able to browse any URL in Browser app for 3 minutes without getting effected by alarms.
step.expectedresults: 1. Web browsing should be working properly without getting effected by alarms.

testsuite.name: BT
testsuite.details: Create test suite for BlueTooth module

testcase.name: BT:Check BlueTooth option enable/disable functionality
testcase.summary: Verify Turn ON/OFF of Bluetooth functionality
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. BT h/w module should be present on the device

step.actions:
1. Go to settings > wireless & networks > Bluetooth 
2. Turn On Bluetooth. Verify whether it is turned ON or not. 
3. Turn OFF Bluetooth. Check whether it is turned OFF or not
step.expectedresults: 1. BT should be turned ON when enabling the BT option and it should be turned OFF when the BT option is unchecked

testcase.name: BT:Check Bluettoth scan functionality
testcase.summary: Verify Scan for devices functionality.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. BT h/w module should be present on the device

step.actions:
1. Go to settings > Wireless & Networks > Bluetooth Settings 
2. Turn On Bluetooth.
3. Turn on Bluetooth in other device and make it as discoverable by other Bluetooth devices
4. Select scan for the devices to check for the available Bluetooth devices around.
5. Turn on Bluetooth in some other device and make sure it is discoverable by other devices. 
6. Select "scan for devices" in DUT.
step.expectedresults: 1. on selecting "scan for devices", device should run the scan again and the available device list should refresh and show the list.

testcase.name: BT:Check BT is pairing to FTP device
testcase.summary: Pair and Connect to FTP Device
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. BT h/w module should be present on the device

step.actions:
1. Go to settings > Wireless & Networks > Bluetooth Settings 
2. Turn On Bluetooth.
3. Check the "discoverable" option.
4. Turn the Bluetooth on on another FTP device and make sure it is discoverable
5. Scan for the Bluetooth devices around
6. Pair with another FTP device 
7. Check for any issues.
step.expectedresults: 1. DUT should be paired and connected with another FTP device.

testcase.name: BT:Check BT is transferring files to FTP devices
testcase.summary: Check for FTP functionality, transfer of file to and from device
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. BT h/w module should be present on the device

step.actions:
1. Go to settings > Wireless & Networks > Bluetooth Settings 
2. Turn On Bluetooth.
3. Check the "discoverable" option.
4. Turn the Bluetooth on on another FTP device and make sure it is discoverable
5. Scan for the Bluetooth devices around
6. Pair with another FTP device 
7. Check the FTP functionality by transferring the files to and from the device.
step.expectedresults: 1. DUT should be paired and connected with another FTP device and files should be transferred to and from the DUT without any issues.

testcase.name: BT:Check BT supports A2DP functionality
testcase.summary: Check for A2DP functionality
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. BT h/w module should be present on the device.
3.Wireless headset/earphones should be present for pairing

step.actions:
1. Go to settings > Wireless & Networks > Bluetooth Settings 
2. Turn On Bluetooth.
3. Check the "discoverable" option.
4. Turn the Bluetooth on on another FTP device and make sure it is discoverable
5. Scan for the Bluetooth devices around
6. Pair and connect with the wireless earphone/headset 
7.Play the music on the device from the paired headset                                          8.Check whether music is streamed from device to wireless headset
step.expectedresults: DUT should be paired and connected with the wireless headset and music should be played from the connected headset.

testcase.name: BT:Check maximum range for BT
testcase.summary: Verify maximum range for bluetooth.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. BT h/w module should be present on the device

step.actions:
1. Go to settings > Wireless & Networks > Bluetooth Settings 
2. Turn On Bluetooth.
3. Turn on Bluetooth in other device and make it as discoverable by other Bluetooth devices
4. Select scan for the devices to check for the available Bluetooth devices around.
5. Turn on Bluetooth in some other device and make sure it is discoverable by other devices. 
6. Select "scan for devices" in DUT.         7. Take the other bluetooth device beyond the maximum bluetooth range. 8.Check whether the moved bluetooth device is detected or not
step.expectedresults: The moved bluetooth should not be detected by DUT once it is moved beyond its maximum range.

testcase.name: BT:Check pair and connect to HID Mouse
testcase.summary: Pair and Connect to HID Mouse
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. BT h/w module should be present on the board.
3. Bluetooth wireless mouse

step.actions:
1. Go to settings > Wireless & Networks > Bluetooth Settings 
2. Turn On Bluetooth.
3. Check the "discoverable" option.
4. Turn on Bluetooth wireless mouse
5. Make sure that wireless mouse is getting detected by the DUT and should appear in the available devices list. 
6. Pair with the Mouse
step.expectedresults: 1. DUT should be paired and connected with HID mouse without any issues.

testcase.name: BT-Str:Check connect/disconnect of HID Mouse 10 times
testcase.summary: Connect/Disconnect HID Mouse 10 times
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. BT h/w module should be present on the board.
3. Bluetooth wireless HID (mouse or keyboard)

step.actions:
1. Go to settings > wireless & networks > Bluetooth setting
2. Turn On Bluetooth.
3. Enable "Visible to all nearby Bluetooth devices" option.
4. Press on "scan for devices" .
5. Pair the device with HID Mouse.
6. Unpair the device with HID mouse.
7. Repeat the above steps from 4 to 6 for 10 times.
step.expectedresults: 1. There should not be any issues while pairing and Unpaired the HID Mouse 10 times.

testcase.name: BT-Str:Check BT option enable/disable 25 times
testcase.summary: Verify user is able to Turn ON/OFF of Bluetooth option 25 times or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. BT h/w module should be present on the device

step.actions:
1. Go to settings > wireless & networks > Bluetooth 
2. Turn On Bluetooth. Verify whether it turned ON or not. 
3. Turn OFF Bluetooth. Check whether it turned off or not
4. Repeat the steps from the 1 to 3 for 25 times.
step.expectedresults: 1. BT should be turned ON when enabling the BT option and it should get turned OFF when BT option is unchecked for each iteration despite 25 iterations.

testcase.name: BT:Check auto connection of BT after restart the device
testcase.summary: Verify Auto connect of Bluetooth paired devices after restart of the target
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. BT h/w module should be present on the board.
3. Should have Bluetooth wireless keyboard or mouse.

step.actions:
1. Go to Settings > Wireless & Networks > Bluetooth settings 
2. Turn On Bluetooth.
3. Turn on the wireless keyboard or mouse
4. From the DUT, scan for the Bluetooth devices around
5. Pair and connect to wireless Mouse/ Keyboard.
6). After Bluetooth devices connected, shut-down the device using power button. 
7). Boot up the device again. 
8). After boot up completes, check whether all the previously paired devices are auto connected or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. After reboot, device should auto connect to previously paired HID devices.

testcase.name: BT:Check BT automatically connected to the previously paired device after disable and enable it
testcase.summary: Verify whether DUT is automatically connected to the previously paired BT devices or not after enabling and disabling the BT option.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. BT h/w module should be present on the board.
3. Should have Bluetooth wireless keyboard or mouse.

step.actions:
1. Go to settings > wireless & networks > Bluetooth  settings
2. Turn On Bluetooth.
3. Scan for the Bluetooth devices around.
4. Turn on the wireless keyboard or mouse
5. From the DUT, scan for the Bluetooth devices around
6. Pair and connect to wireless Mouse/ Keyboard.
7. Turn off the Bluetooth.
8. Now, again Turn on the Bluetooth.
step.expectedresults: 1. After Turn OFF/ON the BT, the device should auto connect to the previously paired HID devices without any issues.

testcase.name: BT:Check BT automatically connected to previously paired device when DUT entered into vicinity area
testcase.summary: Verify whether the DUT is automatically connected to the previously paired BT device when the DUT has entered into the vicinity area of the device
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. BT h/w module should be present on the board.
3. Should have Bluetooth wireless keyboard or mouse.

step.actions:
1. Go to settings > wireless & networks > Bluetooth  settings
2. Turn On Bluetooth.
3. Scan for the Bluetooth devices around.
4. Turn on the wireless keyboard or mouse
5. From the DUT, scan for the Bluetooth devices around
6. Pair and connect to wireless Mouse/ Keyboard.
7. Now Take away the above devices from V200 device Vicinity area.
8. Now come back to within the vicinity range and check whether previously paired HID devices are reconnected or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. The device should auto connect to the previously paired HID devices without any issues.

testcase.name: BT:Check BT visibility time out
testcase.summary: Verify able to set the  BT visibility timeout on DUT or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. BT h/w module should be present on the board.
3. Bluetooth capable peripheral device.

step.actions:
1. Go to settings > Wireless & Networks > Bluetooth Settings 
2. Turn On Bluetooth.
3. Go to BT settings.
4. Try to Set  the Visibility time out to 2 minutes and set DUT to “Visible to all nearby Bluetooth devices”. 
5. Turn on Bluetooth on another bluetooth capable device.
6. Make sure that the V200 Device is get detected by the bluetooth capable device and check the DUT is visible on it till the visibility time out.
7. Repeat above steps 4 to 6 for setting the Visibility timeout of “5 minutes”, “1 hour” and “never time out” options.
step.expectedresults: 1. Should be able to set  the visibility timeout on DUT according to user choice. And also the DUT should be visible to other Bluetooth capable devices in range, till the visibility is timed out.

testcase.name: BT:Check number of FTP devices connected to BT

step.actions:

2. Turn On Bluetooth.

4. Select scan for the devices to check for the available Bluetooth devices around.

step.expectedresults: 1 Device should be able to connect more than one FTP devices at a time.
