testcase.name: Image:Check image rotating functionality
testcase.summary: Check DUT is supporting the rotate  image  functionality or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot the DUT up to Android Main menu.
2. The DUT should support Gallery apk.

step.actions:
1. Copy the image of PNG format into the device.
2. Open the gallery app.
3. Long press on any one of the image file.
4. Click on menu button, Rotate option will be displayed click on that option.
5. It will show dialogue box  and we have to select our required option.
step.expectedresults: 1. The image should be rotated as our specified option without any clashes.

testcase.name: Image:Check image details functionality
testcase.summary: Check DUT is supporting the  image details functionality or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot the DUT up to Android Main menu.
2. The Dut should support Gallery apk.

step.actions:
1. Copy the image of PNG format into the device.
2. Open the gallery app.
3. Long press on any one of the image file.
4. Click on details option.
step.expectedresults: 1. When click on details option of ther Image, the details of the image should display like storage,format etc., without any issue.

testcase.name: Image-Str:Check image slideshow functionality
testcase.summary: Check DUT is supporting the  image slideshow functionality or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot the DUT up to Android Main menu.
2. The Dut should support Gallery apk.

step.actions:
1. Open the Gallery app.
2. Select  slideshow option.
3. Open any image file.
step.expectedresults: 1. Images should be displayed one after another continuously  without any clashes.

testcase.name: Image-Conc:Check image slideshow functoionality while downloading
testcase.summary: Check the DUT is supporting image slideshow while downloading a file through wifi or not
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot the DUT up to Android Main menu.
2. The Dut should support Gallery apk.
3. DUT should have Ethernet connection.

step.actions:
1. Go to browser and type good morning gif download in search menu.
2. Click on any one of available links.
3. Click on any one of gif file  you want to download.
4. Then click on download option showing there.
5. Open the Gallery app.
6. Select  slideshow option.
7. Open any image file.
step.expectedresults:
1. Search results should be displayed without buffering.
2. Download of file should be continued in the background.
3. Images should be displayed one after another continuously  without any clashes.

testcase.name: Text:Check text file open and close functionality
testcase.summary: Check DUT is supporting the text file open and close functionality or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android Main menu
2. Build should support text file(.txt) format .

step.actions:
1. Copy text file into device which has some data,
2. Open text file from any application like chrome or HTML viewer or any other third party document reader applications by going to Settings -> Storage -> Explore and click on that.
3. Then close the file.
step.expectedresults:
1. The text file should be opened and closed without any issues.
2. The .txt file should be readable by us.

testcase.name: Text:Check text file delete functionality
testcase.summary: Check DUT is supporting the text files delete functionality or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android Main menu.
2. Build should support text file(.txt) format.

step.actions:
1. Copy text file into device which has some data.
2. Open text file from any application like chrome or HTML viewer or any other third party document reader applications by going to Settings -> Storage -> Explore and click on that
3. Double click on text file.
4. It will show us delete icon.
5. click on delete icon.
6. It will show a dialogue box "Delete *.txt? Yes or No",we have to select our required option.
step.expectedresults:
1. Delete dialogue box should show with the message of “Are you sure want to delete? Yes or No” when clicked on delete option for text file.
2. The text file should be deleted from the galler,when clicked on “Yes” option and text file should not delete when click on “No” option.

testcase.name: Text-Str:Check multiple(25) text files viewing functionality
testcase.summary: Check DUT is supporting the multiple text files pushed and viewed at once or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android Main menu.
2. Build should support text file(.txt) format.

step.actions:
1. Copy 100 or more .txt files into DUT.
2. Open text file from any application like chrome or HTML viewer or any other third party document reader applications by going to Settings -> Storage -> Explore and click on that. 3. Continuously open 100 text files.
step.expectedresults:
1. All the text files should be opened without any clashes.
2. It should be visible clearly for us.

testsuite.name: PowerSuspendResume
testsuite.details: Create test suite for Power, suspend and resume modules

testcase.name: PowerSuspendResume:Check power cable plugin detection
testcase.summary: Check power cable plug-in functionality
testcase.preconditions:
1. Working device should be available.
2. Power cable with adopter should be available.

step.actions:
1. Connect the power adopter to Power resource.
2. Now plug-in the power cable to device power port.
3. Check whether Red led is shown or not. If DUT shown the Red color led at power cable plug-in port then power cable is detected by DUT.
step.expectedresults: 1. After power cable plug-in to power connector in the device then Red color led should show at power cable port, it means power cable should be detected by DUT.

testcase.name: PowerSuspendResume:Check LEDs colors at power connector
testcase.summary: Check whether Red color LED and Green color LEDs are sown at power connector on the device when the device is booting.
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Power cable with adopter should be available and it should be connected to power source.

step.actions:
1. Now plug-in the power cable to device power port.
2. Turn on the device by using power button.
3. Check whether Red color LED and green color LEDs are shown at power cable plug-in port or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. After power on the device, the Red color LED and green color LED should show at power cable plug-in point.

testcase.name: PowerSuspendResume:Check device suspend/resume functionality
testcase.summary: Check the Display after Suspend and Resume
testcase.preconditions: 1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.

step.actions:
1.Connect the HDMI display to the board and then power on the board. Check the display screen.
2. Disable the stay awake option in developer options
3. Set the wake time in display to 15 seconds
4.Suspend and resume the DUT then check the Display.
step.expectedresults: DUT Should enter into the sleep mode and display screen becomes blank and also device should resume from suspend state properly,Display screen should shown properly without any issues.

testcase.name: PowerSuspendResume:Check BT connection after suspend/resume
testcase.summary: Check bluetooth is connected after suspend and resume
testcase.preconditions: 1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.

step.actions:
1.Connect the HDMI display to the board and then power on the board. Check the display screen.
2. Enable bluetooth and connect to some other device                                                                3.Disable the stay awake option in developer options
4. Set the wake time in display to 15 seconds
5.Suspend and resume the DUT then check the Display.                                                                         6.Check whether bluetooth is still connected to the device after resume
step.expectedresults: DUT Should enter into the sleep and resume properly,and bluetooth should be connected to the device after resume.

testcase.name: PowerSuspendResume:Check WiFi after suspend/resume
testcase.summary: Check WiFi is connected after suspend and resume
testcase.preconditions: 1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.

step.actions:
1.Connect the HDMI display to the board and then power on the board.Check the display screen.
2. Enable WiFi and connect to some network available                                                                3.Disable the stay awake option in developer options
4. Set the wake time in display to 15 seconds
5.Suspend and resume the DUT then check the Display.                                                                         6.Check whether WiFi is still connected to the device after resume
step.expectedresults: DUT Should enter into the sleep and resume properly,and WiFi should be connected to the device after resume.

testcase.name: PowerSuspendResume:Check adb connection after suspend/resume
testcase.summary: Check the adb connection after Suspend and Resume
testcase.preconditions: 1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.

step.actions:
1.Connect the HDMI display to the board and then power on the board. Check the display screen.
2. Disable the stay awake option in developer options
3. Set the wake time in display to 15 seconds
4.Suspend and resume the DUT then check the Display.                                                                      5.Check whether adb is able to connect to the device
step.expectedresults: DUT Should enter into the sleep and resume properly,and adb should be able to connect to the device with adb connect commands

testcase.name: PowerSuspendResume:Check audio playback during device suspend state
testcase.summary: Verify audio playback functionality during device suspend state.
testcase.preconditions:
1.DUT boots up to Android Main menu
2.Copy music files into device.

step.actions:
1.Open Music application
2.Start audio playback
3. Set the display time for 15 seconds.
4. After device entered into suspend state, check whether audio playback is still happening or not.
step.expectedresults:
1. After display/screen timeout completed, DUT should entered into sleep mode.
2. playback should be continue, even when the display goes suspend mode

testcase.name: PowerSuspendResume:Check DUT wakeup with Alarm event
testcase.summary: Verify DUT wakeup functionality with Alarm event.
testcase.preconditions: 1.DUT boots up to Android Main menu

step.actions:
1.Press on Clock application.
2.Press on clock symbol.
3.Press on Add alarm.
4.Set Alarm to 5 min and press on "Done" button.
5.Set screen time out to 15 seconds.
6. After screen time out completed, device entered into sleep mode.
7.Now wait until alarm set time completed and check whether device is wakeup from suspend state with alarm event.
step.expectedresults:
1. Device should go to suspend state after screen time out completed.
2.DUT should wake up from suspend state once alarm time up.

testcase.name: PowerSuspendResume:Check Airplane mode after suspend/resume
testcase.summary: Verify airplane mode functionality after suspend and resume
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Power cable with adopter should be available and it should be connected to power source.

step.actions:
1. Goto settings.
2. Goto wireless & network settings → More.
3. Check whether system is able to enable the Airplane option or not.
4. Disable the stay awake option in developer options.
5. Set the wake time in display to 15 seconds.
6. Suspend and resume the DUT then check Airplane mode.
step.expectedresults: 1. Airplane mode should be enabled after suspend and resume.

testcase.name: PowerSuspendResume:Check again system going to suspend/resume after reboot
testcase.summary: Verify if the device again goes to suspend and resumes back after reboot
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Power cable with adopter should be available and it should be connected to power source.

step.actions:
1. Connect the DP  display to the board and then power on the board.
2. Check the display screen.
3. Disable the stay awake option in developer options.
4. Set the wake time in display to 15 seconds.
5. Suspend and resume the DUT then check the Display.
6. Reboot the device and check if the device suspends after 15 seconds.
step.expectedresults: 1. DUT should suspend and resume back after reboot also.

testcase.name: PowerSuspendResume:Check device suspend/resume after 15 seconds when sleep time is set
testcase.summary: Check device goes to suspend state in 15 seconds if selected in sleep time options
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Power cable with adopter should be available and it should be connected to power source.

step.actions:
1.Connect the DP  display to the board and then power on the board. Check the display screen.
2. Disable the stay awake option in developer options.
3. Set the wake time in display to 15 seconds.
4.Check whether the device Suspends in 15 seconds and resume the DUT then check the Display.
step.expectedresults: 1. Device should suspend in 15 seconds.

testcase.name: PowerSuspendResume:Check device suspend/resume after 30 seconds when sleep time is set
testcase.summary: Check device goes to suspend state in 30 seconds if selected in sleep time options
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Power cable with adopter should be available and it should be connected to power source.

step.actions:
1. Connect the DP  display to the board and then power on the board. Check the display screen.
2. Disable the stay awake option in developer options.
3. Set the wake time in display to 30 seconds.
4. Check whether the device Suspends in 15 seconds and resume the DUT then check the Display.
step.expectedresults: 1. Device should suspend in 30 seconds.

testcase.name: PowerSuspendResume:Check device suspend/resume after 1 minute when sleep time is set
testcase.summary: Check device goes to suspend state in 1 minute if selected in sleep time options
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Power cable with adopter should be available and it should be connected to power source.

step.actions:
1. Connect the DP  display to the board and then power on the board. Check the display screen.
2. Disable the stay awake option in developer options.
3. Set the wake time in display to 1 minute.
4. Check whether the device Suspends in 1 minute and resume the DUT then check the Display.
step.expectedresults: 1. Device should suspend in 1 minute.

testcase.name: PowerSuspendResume:Check device suspend functionality if stay awake option is enabled
testcase.summary: Check if DUT doesn't go to suspend state if stay awake is selected in developer settings
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Power cable with adopter should be available and it should be connected to power source.

step.actions:
1. Connect the DP  display to the board and then power on the board. Check the display screen.
2. Enable the stay awake option in developer options.
3. Set the wake time in display to 15 seconds.
4. Check whether the device Suspends or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. Device should not suspend as the stay awake is selected.

testcase.name: PowerSuspendResume-Str:Check display after suspend/resume for 20 times
testcase.summary: Check the Display after Suspend and Resume for 20 times
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Power cable with adopter should be available and it should be connected to power source.

step.actions:
1. Connect the DP  display to the board and then power on the board. Check the display screen.
2. Disable the stay awake option in developer options.
3. Set the wake time in display to 15 seconds.
4. Suspend and resume the DUT for 10 to 15 times and check the Display.
step.expectedresults: 1. DUT Should enter into the sleep mode and display screen should become black and also device should resume from suspend state properly,Display screen should be shown properly without any issues.

testcase.name: PowerSuspendResume-Str:Check BT connection after suspend/resume for 20 times
testcase.summary: Check bluetooth is connected after suspend and resume for 20 times
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Power cable with adopter should be available and it should be connected to power source.

step.actions:
1. Connect the DP  display to the board and then power on the board. Check the display screen.
2. Enable bluetooth and connect to some other device.
3. Disable the stay awake option in developer options.
4. Set the wake time in display to 15 seconds.
5. Suspend and resume the DUT then check the Display.
6. Check whether bluetooth is still connected to the device after resume.
7. Repeat 5 and 6th step for 20 times.
step.expectedresults: 1. DUT Should enter into the sleep and resume properly,and bluetooth should be connected to the device after resume for every iteration.

testcase.name: PowerSuspendResume-Str:Check WiFi connection after suspend/resume for 20 times
testcase.summary: Check WiFi is connected after suspend and resume for 20 times
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Power cable with adopter should be available and it should be connected to power source.

step.actions:
1. Connect the DP  display to the board and then power on the board.Check the display screen.
2. Enable WiFi and connect to some network available.
3. Disable the stay awake option in developer options.
4. Set the wake time in display to 15 seconds.
5. Suspend and resume the DUT then check the Display.
6. Check whether WiFi is still connected to the device after resume.
7. Repeat 5 and 6th step for 20 times.
step.expectedresults: 1. DUT Should enter into the sleep and resume properly,and WiFi should be connected to the device after resume for every iteration.

testcase.name: PowerSuspendResume-Str:Check device audio playback functionality during suspend state for 20 times
testcase.summary: Verify audio playback functionality during device suspend state for 20 times
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Power cable with adopter should be available and it should be connected to power source.

step.actions:
1. Open Music application.
2. Start audio playback.
3. Set the display time for 15 seconds.
4. After device entered into suspend state, check whether audio playback is still happening or not.
5. Repeat 4th  step for 20 times.
step.expectedresults:
1. After display/screen timeout completed, DUT should entered into sleep mode.
2. playback should be continue, even when the display goes suspend mode  for every iteration.

testcase.name: PowerSuspendResume-Str:Check Airplane mode after suspend/resume for 20 times
testcase.summary: Verify airplane mode functionality after suspend and resume for 20 times
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Power cable with adopter should be available and it should be connected to power source.

step.actions:
1. Goto settings.
2. Goto wireless & network settings → More.
3. Check whether system is able to enable the Airplane option or not.
4. Disable the stay awake option in developer options.
5. Set the wake time in display to 15 seconds.
6. Suspend and resume the DUT then check Airplane mode.
7. Repeat 6th  step for 20 times.
step.expectedresults: 1. Airplane mode should be enabled after suspend and resume for every iteration.

testcase.name: PowerSuspendResume-Str:Check device again going to suspend/resume after 20 times reboot
testcase.summary: Verify if the device again goes to suspend and resumes back after reboot for 20 times
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Power cable with adopter should be available and it should be connected to power source.

step.actions:
1. Connect the DP  display to the board and then power on the board. Check the display screen.
2. Disable the stay awake option in developer options.
3. Set the wake time in display to 15 seconds.
4. Suspend and resume the DUT then check the Display.
5. Reboot the device and check if the device suspends after 15 seconds.
6. Repeat 5th  step for 20 times.
step.expectedresults: 1. DUT should suspend and resume back after reboot also for every iteration.

testcase.name: PowerSuspendResume-Conc:Check BT,WiFi and Airplane mode after suspend/resume
testcase.summary: Check Bluetooth, Wifi, and airplane mode after suspend and resume
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Power cable with adopter should be available and it should be connected to power source.

step.actions:
1. Connect the DP  display to the board and then power on the board. Check the display screen.
2. Enable airplane mode in the settings.
3. Enable bluetooth and connect to some other device.
4. Enable Wifi and connect to some network available.
5. Disable the stay awake option in developer options.
6. Set the wake time in display to 15 seconds.
7. Suspend and resume the DUT then check the Display.
8. Check whether bluetooth is still connected to the device, Wifi is connected to the network and airplane mode is still enabled after resume.
step.expectedresults: 1. Bluetooth should be still connected to the device, Wifi should be connected to the network and airplane mode should be enabled after resume.

testcase.name: PowerSuspendResume-Conc:Check BT file transfer,WiFi download after suspend/resume
testcase.summary: Check BT file transfer and downloading files after suspend and resume
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Power cable with adopter should be available and it should be connected to power source.

step.actions:
1. Connect the DP  display to the board and then power on the board. Check the display screen.
2. Enable bluetooth and connect to some other device.
3. Enable Wifi and connect to some network available.
4. Transfer large Files to FTP devices.
5. Download large files while FTP files are transferred.
6. Disable the stay awake option in developer options.
7. Set the wake time in display to 15 seconds.
8. Suspend and resume the DUT then check the Display.
9. Check whether BT files are transferred and files are downloaded without any issues.
step.expectedresults: 1. BT files should be transferred and files should be downloaded without getting effected by suspend and resume.

testcase.name: PowerSuspendResume-Conc:Check is same browser displaying after suspend/resume
testcase.summary: Check if the same web browser is displayed after suspend and resume
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Power cable with adopter should be available and it should be connected to power source.

step.actions:
1. Connect the DP  display to the board and then power on the board. Check the display screen .
2. Enable Wifi and connect to some network available.
3. Open the Browser Apk,
4. Open the “www.msn.com” URL.
5. Check whether the MSN website open or not.
6. Disable the stay awake option in developer options.
7. Set the wake time in display to 15 seconds.
8. Suspend and resume the DUT then check the Display if the browser is displayed.
step.expectedresults: 1. Browser opened should be displayed after suspend and resume.

testcase.name: PowerSuspendResume: Conc: Check downloading files after suspend and resume
testcase.summary: Check downloading files after suspend and resume

step.actions:
1. Connect the DP  display to the board and then power on the board. Check the display screen.
2. Enable bluetooth and connect to some other device.
3. Enable Wifi and connect to some network available.
4. Download large files.
5. Disable the stay awake option in developer options.
6. Set the wake time in display to 15 seconds.
7. Suspend and resume the DUT then check the Display.
8. Check whether files are downloaded without any issues.
step.expectedresults: files should be downloaded without getting effected by suspend and resume.

testsuite.name: Camera
testsuite.details: Create test suite for Camera module

testcase.name: Camera:Check camera open
testcase.summary: Verify Camera is Opening without any Flickering
testcase.preconditions:
1.Boot the device completely up to home screen
2.Camera module should be present on the DUT
3.Build should support Camera and Display functionality.

step.actions:
1.Launch the Camera Application.
2.Look for any flickering or corruptions on start up.
step.expectedresults: 1.Camera should launch without any flickering or corruptions.

testcase.name: Camera:Check camera close
testcase.summary: Verify whether camera is closing without any issues.
testcase.preconditions:
1.Boot the device completely up to home screen
2.Camera module should be present on the DUT
3.Build should support Camera and Display functionality.

step.actions:
1. Launch the camera application.   
2. Close camera app 
3. Check whether camera is closing without any issues.
step.expectedresults: 1. Camera should close smoothly without any issues.

testcase.name: Camera:Check camera image preview
testcase.summary: Check the Image Preview Displayed
testcase.preconditions:
1.Boot the device completely up to home screen
2.Camera module should be present on the DUT
3.Build should support Camera and Display functionality.

step.actions:
1. Open Camera app
2. Check the image Preview Displayed
step.expectedresults:
1. There should not be any issues while launching camera application
 
2. Image preview should appear without any blur or other issues.

testcase.name: Camera:Check able to capture an image
testcase.summary: Check whether Camera is able to capture image
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Camera functionality should be supported in the build

step.actions: 1 Select camera icon available in home screen 2.Try to capture the image in Normal mode.       3.Check whether proper image is captured and stored in the respective folder in sdcard.
step.expectedresults: Image should be captured and stored in the respective folder in sdcard.

testcase.name: Camera:Check camera is auto focus of image
testcase.summary: Check whether Camera is able to Auto focus while capturing image
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Camera functionality should be supported in the build

step.actions:
1 Select camera icon available in home screen.

2.Try to focus a specific object while capturing the image.                                                                3.Check whether the specific object is focused  in the image captured.
step.expectedresults: Specified object should be focused in the image captured.

testcase.name: Camera:Check time for opening camera application
testcase.summary: Calculate time taken to open camera application
testcase.preconditions:
1.DUT should boot up to Android Main menu
2.Build should be support Camera.

step.actions:
1.Open camera app.
2.Capture time taken to open camera app
step.expectedresults: 1.Camera should open within 2 seconds.

testcase.name: Camera:Check camera open and close multiple times
testcase.summary: Check stability of camera after Open/Close multiple times
testcase.preconditions:
1.Boot the device completely up to home screen
2.Camera module should be present on the DUT
3.Build should support Camera and Display functionality.

step.actions:
1. Launch the camera application.   
2. Close camera app
3. Repeat above steps for multiple times.
4.Check stability of camera
step.expectedresults: 1. Camera should open/close  without any issue for each time.

testcase.name: Camera:Check different exposure images
testcase.summary: Capture an image with Different  Exposure  values.
testcase.preconditions:
1.DUT should boot up to Android Main menu
2. Camera should be supported by the build.
3. Use any standard colour or black and white image as target image.

step.actions:
1. Open Camera app.
2. Go to settings.
3. Capture images by setting different Exposure values like +2, +1, 0, -1, -2
4. Check the difference of different exposure Capture an images .
step.expectedresults:
1. Images should be captured and should be stored in the DUT with changed Settings of the image.
2. Successive images from -2 EV to +2 EV should appear appear brighter (e.g. -2 EV should be the darkest and +2 EV should be the brightest)

testcase.name: Camera:Check auto exposure functionality
testcase.summary: Capture the image with Auto Exposure.
testcase.preconditions:
1.DUT should boot up to Android Main menu
2. Camera should be supported by the build.
3. Use any standard colour or black and white image as target image.

step.actions:
1. Open Camera app

2. Set Auto Exposure mode to true

3. Capture an image .
step.expectedresults: 1.Image should be captured and should be stored in the DUT with changed Settings of the image.

testcase.name: Camera:Check image color quality
testcase.summary: Verify the colour quality of the captured image
testcase.preconditions:
1.DUT should boot up to Android Main menu
2. Camera should be supported by the build.
3. Use any standard colour or black and white image as target image.

step.actions:
1. Launch the camera application.
2. Capture the images of different coloured objects like pure white, pure black, mixed colours etc..
3. Verify the colour quality of the image captured.
step.expectedresults:
1. Camera application should be launched without any issue
2. Images of different colours should be captured.
3. There should not be any artifacts/blurness in the image captured and the colour quality should be fine as expected.
4.If the image contains any lines, they should be clear with out any artifacts.

testcase.name: Camera:Check switching between Camera and Gallery app
testcase.summary: Verify switch between Camera app and Gallery
testcase.preconditions:
1.DUT should boot up to Android Main menu
2. Camera should be supported by the build.
3. Use any standard colour or black and white image as target image.

step.actions:
1. Open camera app.
2. Take the images .
3. Press on image viewer.
4. Open images.
5. Now pictures are open in a gallery.
6. Now press back button or camera button in gallery.
step.expectedresults:
1. There should not be any issues while launching camera application
2. Image preview should appear without any blur
3. No issues while capturing the images
4. Images should be stored in DUT.
5. Images are open in a gallery without showing any issue.
6. Switch between gallery and camera should be work fine and should not be show any force closes while switching between them.

testcase.name: Camera:Check dataloss in the captured image
testcase.summary: Compare the captured image with that of the preview image to ensure that there is no loss of data.
testcase.preconditions:
1.DUT should boot up to Android Main menu
2. Camera should be supported by the build.
3. Use any standard colour or black and white image as target image.

step.actions:
1. Launch the camera application.
2. Capture an image.
3. check the captured image
step.expectedresults:
1.Camera should launch with out any flickering or corruptions.
2. The captured image should be exactly same as it was in the preview window.
3. No missing portion either in image or in preview should happen.

testcase.name: Camera:Check Camera and Gallery app switching multiple times
testcase.summary: Verify switch between Camera app and Gallery for 25 times.
testcase.preconditions:
1.DUT should boot up to Android Main menu
2. Camera should be supported by the build.
3. Use any standard colour or black and white image as target image.

step.actions:
1. Open camera app.
2. Take the images .
3. Press on image viewer.
4. Open images.
5. Now pictures are open in a gallery.
6. Now press back button or camera button in gallery.
7. Repeat the steps from 3 to 6 25 times.
step.expectedresults:
1. There should not be any issues while launching camera application
2. Image preview should appear without any blur
3. No issues while capturing the images
4. Images should be stored in DUT.
5. Images are open in a gallery without showing any issue.
6. Switch between gallery and camera should be work fine for each iteration.

3. Use any standard colour or black and white image as target image.

step.actions:

2. Try to capture 500 images.
step.expectedresults: 1. Camera should be able to capture 500 images continuously without any issue

testcase.name: Camera:Check VGA mode image capturing

2. check the Image resolution and make sure that it will be 640x480 in size.

testsuite.name: Graphics
testsuite.details: Create test suite for Graphics

testcase.name: Graphics:Check 3D graphics tests in Antutu benchmark
testcase.summary: Check whether 3D graphic tests are playing without any issues or not
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2. The “AnTuTu3DBench-com.antutu.benchmark.full-6000400-v6.0.4.apk” benchmark should be available.

step.actions:
1. Install the “AnTuTu3DBench-com.antutu.benchmark.full-6000400-v6.0.4.apk” in the device.                                                               
2. Open the above installed apk.
3. Check whether 3D graphics tests(Marooned and Garden) are playing without any corruptions or not.
step.expectedresults: The antutu 3D graphics tests should be played without any corruptions.

testcase.name: Graphics:Check OpenGLES graphics in 3D Mark
testcase.summary: Check whether all the OpenGL ES graphics tests are playing without any issues or not in 3D Mark  benchmark
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2. The “3D Mark-the gammers bench mark apk”  should be available.

step.actions:
1. Install the “3D Mark(android_gammers_com.futuremark.dmandroid.application_2.0.4580-4580.apk)-the gammers benchmark” in the device.
2. Open the above installed apk.
3. Playback the 3D Mark slingshot extreme and slingshot extreme unlimitted tests for OpenGL ES and check all are playing without any corruptions or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. All the OpenGL ES tests in Slingshot extreme and slingshot exreme unlimitted tests in 3D mark should be played without any corruptions.

testcase.name: Graphics:Check Vulkan graphics in 3DMark
testcase.summary: Check Vulkan graphics tests in 3DMark-the gamers benchmark
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2. The “3D Mark-the gammers bench mark apk”  should be available.

step.actions:
1. Install the “3D Mark(android_gammers_com.futuremark.dmandroid.application_2.0.4580-4580.apk)-the gammers benchmark” in the device.
2. Open the above installed apk.
3. Run Viulkan graphics tests and check vulkan graphics tests are playing without any issues or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. All the Vulkan graphics  tests in 3D mark should be played without any corruptions.

testcase.name: Graphics:Check graphics tests in GFXBench GL Benchmark
testcase.summary: Check Graphics tests in GFXBench GL Benchmark 4.0
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2. The “GFXBench GL Benchmark 4.0”  should be available.

step.actions:
1. Install the “GFXBench GL Benchmark 4.0” in the device.
2. Open the above installed apk.
3. Run High level tests and check all are playing without any corruptions or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. All the High Level tests in GFX GL benchmark should run without any graphic corruptions.

testcase.name: Graphics:Check Nenamark functionality
testcase.summary: Check Nenamark is running without any issues or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2. The “NenaMark2-se.nena.nenamark2-5-v2.4.apk” benchmark  should be available.

step.actions:
1. Install the “NenaMark2” in the device.
2. Open and run the above installed apk.
3. Check whether graphic test is run without any corruptions or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. Graphic test in NenaMark2 should run without any graphic corruptions.

testcase.name: Graphics:Check 2D graphics in PassMarkPerformanceTest benchmark
testcase.summary: Check 2D graphics tests in PassMarkPerformanceTest benchmark
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2. The “PassMarkPerformanceTest” benchmark apk  should be available.

step.actions:
1. Install the “PassMarkPerformanceTest” benchmark apk  in the device.
2. Open the above installed apk.
3. Run 2D tests and check whether 2D graphics tests are playing without any corruptions or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. 2D Graphics tests in “PassMarkPerformanceTest” apk should run without any graphic corruptions.

testcase.name: Graphics:Check all tests are passed in CTSOpenGLTestCases
testcase.summary: Check all the tests are passed in CtsOpenGLTestCases module
testcase.preconditions:
1. The CTS binary “android-cts-7.1_r17-linux_x86-x86.zip' should be availlable.
2. Device should be boot upto android lock screen.
3. Setup the CTS as per run  instructions mentioned in CTS google site.

step.actions:
1. Connect the device adb over ethernet.
2. Open PC terminal
3. Go to downloaded CTS binary path i.e. “cd android-cts/tools”  and run the "CtsOpenGLTestCases" module with the command "./cts-tradefed run cts -m CtsOpenGLTestCases" .
4. Observed whether all tests are passed without any issues.
step.expectedresults: 1. All the tests in CTS “CtsOpenGLTestCases” should be passed.

testcase.name: Graphics:Check all tests are passed in CtsGraphicsTestCases
testcase.summary: Check all the tests are passed in CtsGraphicsTestCases module

step.expectedresults: 1. All the tests in CTS “CtsGraphicsTestCases” should be passed.

testcase.name: Graphics-Str:Check suspend and resume when Antutu benchmark is running for 10 times
testcase.summary: Check suspend and resume when Antutu 3D benchmark is running for 10 times.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2. The “AnTuTu3DBench-com.antutu.benchmark.full-6000400-v6.0.4.apk” benchmark should be available.

step.actions:
1. Install the “AnTuTu3DBench-com.antutu.benchmark.full-6000400-v6.0.4.apk” in the device.
2. Open the above installed apk.
3. Run the tests.
4. While 3D Mark tests are running, try to suspend the device and also try to resume the device from suspend state.
5. Repeat the above steps for 10 times.
step.expectedresults:
For each iteration:
1. Device should enter into suspend state completely when try to suspend the device while running the 3D Mark graphics tests.
2. Device should resume from the suspend  when try to resume and after resume graphics tests should run properly.

testcase.name: Graphics-Conc:Check 3D Mark benchmark while playing audio
testcase.summary: Run 3D mark benchmark during audio playback
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2. The “3D Mark-the gamers bench mark apk”  should be available.
3. Audio files should be available.

step.actions:
1. Install “3D Mark benchmark” in the device.
2. Push audio files into device.
3. Open music player and playback the above copied audio file.
4. Press Home button.
5. Open the above  installed 3D Mark benchmark.
6. Run graphics tests in 3D mark.
step.expectedresults: 1. Graphics tests should run in 3D mark even though audio playback is going on.

testcase.name: Graphics-Conc:Check 3D Mark benchmark when WiFi and BT are on
testcase.summary: Run 3D Mark benchmark when WiFi & BT are on
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2. The “3D Mark-the gamers bench mark apk”  should be available.
3. WiFi and BT module should present in the device.

step.actions:
1. Install “3D Mark benchmark” in the device.
2. Go to settings > wireless & networks > enable BT and WiFi.
3. Open the above  installed 3D Mark benchmark.
4. Run graphics tests in 3D mark.
step.expectedresults: 1. Graphics tests should run in 3D mark when BT and WiFi both are in ON state.

testcase.name: Graphics-Conc:Check 3D Mark benchmark when transfering files using BT
testcase.summary: Run 3D mark benchmark while BT file transfer is going on
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2. The “3D Mark-the gamers bench mark apk”  should be available.
3. WiFi and BT module should present in the device.

step.actions:
1. Install “3D Mark benchmark” in the device.
2. Go to settings > wireless & networks > enable BT option and connect any other FTP device.
3. Do file transfer to other connected FTP device.
4. While file transfer is going on, open the above  installed 3D Mark benchmark apk and run graphics tests in 3D mark.
step.expectedresults: 1. Graphics tests should run in 3D mark benchmark while file transfer is going on to other FTP device.

testcase.name: Graphics-Conc:Check 3D Mark benchmark when downloading files
testcase.summary: Run 3D mark benchmark when file downloading is under progress
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2. The “3D Mark-the gamers bench mark apk”  should be available.
3. WiFi or Ethernet modules should present in the device.

step.actions:
1. Install “3D Mark benchmark” in the device.
2. Connect the Device to Ethernet or WiFi router.
3. Open browser and start downloading a large file.
4. While downloading the file is under progress, open the above  installed 3D Mark benchmark apk and run graphics tests in 3D mark.
step.expectedresults: 1. Graphics tests should run in 3D mark benchmark while file downloading is under progress from the browser.

testcase.name: Graphics-Conc:Check alarm when Antutu 3D benchmark is rnning

testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2. The “AnTuTu3DBench-com.antutu.benchmark.full-6000400-v6.0.4.apk” benchmark should be available.

step.actions:
1. Install the “AnTuTu3DBench-com.antutu.benchmark.full-6000400-v6.0.4.apk” in the device.                                                        
2. Open Alarm application in the device and set Alarm time to 1min.
3. Open the above installed apk.
4. Run the tests.
5. Alarm dialog should show on the screen once time up.
step.expectedresults: 1. Alarm dialog should show on the display once alarm time-up while running the Antutu 3D graphics tests.

testcase.name: Graphics-Conc:Check 3D Mark benchmark while using adb push/pull
testcase.summary: Check 3D Mark benchmark is running while adb push and pull operations are going on.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2. The “AnTuTu3DBench-com.antutu.benchmark.full-6000400-v6.0.4.apk” benchmark should be available.

step.actions:
1. Install the “AnTuTu3DBench-com.antutu.benchmark.full-6000400-v6.0.4.apk” in the device.
2. Open the above installed apk.
3. Run the tests.
4. While 3D Mark tests are running, try to push/pull the files to/from the device.
step.expectedresults: 1. 3D Mark tests should run even though push/pull operations are going on and also push/pull of files should be successful while running the graphics tests.

testcase.name: Graphics-Conc:Check suspend and resume when Antutu 3D benchmark is running
testcase.summary: Check suspend and resume when Antutu 3D benchmark is running.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2. The “AnTuTu3DBench-com.antutu.benchmark.full-6000400-v6.0.4.apk” benchmark should be available.

step.actions:
1. Install the “AnTuTu3DBench-com.antutu.benchmark.full-6000400-v6.0.4.apk” in the device.
2. Open the above installed apk.
3. Run the tests.
4. While 3D  tests are running, try to suspend the device and also try to resume the device from suspend state.
step.expectedresults:
1. Device should enter into suspend state completely when try to suspend the device while running the 3D  graphics tests.
2. Device should resume from the suspend  when try to resume and after resume graphics tests should run properly.

testcase.name: Graphics-Conc:Check playing game when listening audio through USB/BT/Audio jack
testcase.summary: While playing games - listen audio through USB/BT/Audio jack
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2.  Angry birds game apk should be available.
3. Audio Jack,BT headset and USB headset should be available.

step.actions:
1. Install Angry birds game apk in the device.
2. Play the above installed game in the device.
3. Connect the Audio jack to device, USB headset to device or BT headset and check whether audio sound is coming or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. Audio sound should be come in the connected Audio Jack, USB headset and BT headset while playing the game.

testcase.name: Graphics-Conc:Check GL GFX benchmark while downloading,playing audio through USB/BT speakers
testcase.summary: adb push/pull + wifi download + GL GFX benchmarks / Games  + USB/BT speakers for audio from graphics app
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2.  GFX GL benchmark should be available.
3. Audio Jack,BT headset and USB headset should be available.
4. WiFi module should present on the device.

step.actions:
1. Go to settings, enable WiFi and connect it to known router which has internet.
2. Install GFX GL benchmark in the device.
3. Connect USB/BT headset.
4. Open browser and start downloading a large file.
5. Open above installed GFX benchmark and start playing graphics tests.
6. Start push/pull the files to/from the device.
7. Check audio is coming from the USB or BT head set or not for GFX  benchmark.
step.expectedresults: 1. Audio sound should be hear in USB or BT headset for GFX graphics benchmark tests while push/pull operations are going on plus file download is under progress.

testcase.name: Graphics-Conc:Check angry bird game while downloading,playing audio through USB/BT speakers
testcase.summary: adb push/pull + wifi download +angry bird  + USB/BT speakers for audio from MP3
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2.  Vellamo benchmark should be available.
3. Audio Jack,BT headset and USB headset should be available.
4. WiFi module should present on the device.

step.actions:
1. Go to settings, enable WiFi and connect it to known router which has Internet.
2. Install Angry Birds in the device.
3. Connect USB/BT headset.
4. Copy .mp3 audio file.
5. Open browser and start downloading a large file.
6. Open Music player and start playback above copied .mp3 file.
7. Open above installed angry birds and start the game.
8. Start push/pull the files to/from the device.
9. Check audio is coming from the USB or BT head set or not for .mp3 file.
step.expectedresults:
1. Audio sound should be hear in USB or BT headset for .mp3 audio file.
2. Downloading a file should be success.
3. Push/Pull the file to/from the device should be successful.
4. Angry Birds should run.

testcase.name: Graphics-Conc:Check by stoping Antutu in middle and open other graphics for 3 times
testcase.summary: adb push/pull + wifi download + Vellamo benchmark  + USB/BT speakers for audio from MP3
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2. Vellamo benchmark should be available.
3. Audio Jack,BT headset and USB headset should be available.
4. WiFi module should present on the device.

step.actions:
1. Install the “AnTuTu3DBench-com.antutu.benchmark.full-6000400-v6.0.4.apk” in the device.
2. Install 3D Mark-the gamers benchmark in the device.
3. Open the Antutu benchmark and start run the tests.
4. Stop the above tests in the middle.
5. Open 3D Mark-the gamers benchmark and start to play the tests in it. check whether tests are running or not.
6. Repeat the steps from 3 to 5 for 3 times.
step.expectedresults:
For each iteration:
1. Antutu benchmark tests should run when start the tests in it and should stop the tests when stopped them.
2. The tests in 3D Mark-the gamers benchmark should start playing after stop the Antutu benchmarks tests in the middle.

testcase.name: Graphics-Conc:Check to vary audio volume while running Antutu benchmark
testcase.summary: Check audio volume up and down while running Antut 3D benchmark.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2. The “AnTuTu3DBench-com.antutu.benchmark.full-6000400-v6.0.4.apk” benchmark should be available.
3. Device should have volume up and down buttons.

step.actions:
1. Install the “AnTuTu3DBench-com.antutu.benchmark.full-6000400-v6.0.4.apk” in the device.
2. Connect the Audio headset to the device.
3. Open the Antutu benchmark and start run the tests.
4. Change the volume up and down.
5. Check whether audio volume is increased/decreased accordingly or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. Audio sound should be hear with high and low when  volume increased and decreased for Antutu 3D benchmark.

testcase.name: Graphics-Memory:Check memory leak when 3D Mark is running
testcase.summary: Check memory leak when 3D Mark test are running in the device.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2. The “3D Mark-the gamers bench mark apk”  should be available.
3. Audio files should be available.

step.actions:
1. Install “3D Mark benchmark” in the device.
2. Open and run the above installed 3D Mark benchmark.
3. Open PC terminal.
4. While graphics tests are playing in 3D mark, entered the “adb shell dumpsys meminfo” command and collect the memory information.
5. Observe memory leak information in the above collected log.
step.expectedresults: 1. There should not be any memory leak when running the 3D Mark benchmark graphics test in the device.

testcase.name: Graphics-Memory:Check memory leak when CtsGraphicTestCases module is runnin
testcase.summary: Check memory leak when CtsGraphicsTestCases module is running
testcase.preconditions:
1. The CTS binary “android-cts-7.1_r17-linux_x86-x86.zip' should be availlable.
2. Device should be boot upto android lock screen.
3. Setup the CTS as per run  instructions mentioned in CTS google site.

step.actions:
1. Connect the device adb over ethernet.
2. Open PC terminal
3. Go to downloaded CTS binary path i.e. “cd android-cts/tools”  and run the "CtsGraphicsTestCases" module with the command "./cts-tradefed run cts -m CtsGraphicsTestCases" .
4. While graphics tests are playing, entered the “adb shell dumpsys meminfo” command in PC terminal and collect the memory information.
5. Observe memory leak information in the above collected log.
step.expectedresults: 1. There should not be any memory leak when running the “CtsGraphicsTestCases”  tests in the device.

testcase.name: Graphics-Memory:Check memory leak when CtsOpenGLTestccases module is running
testcase.summary: Check memory leak when CtsOpenGLTestCases module is running
testcase.preconditions:
1. The CTS binary “android-cts-7.1_r17-linux_x86-x86.zip' should be availlable.
2. Device should be boot upto android lock screen.
3. Setup the CTS as per run  instructions mentioned in CTS google site.

step.actions:
1. Connect the device adb over ethernet.
2. Open PC terminal
3. Go to downloaded CTS binary path i.e. “cd android-cts/tools”  and run the "CtsOpenGLTestCases" module with the command "./cts-tradefed run cts -m CtsOpenGLTestCases" .
4. While graphics tests are playing, entered the “adb shell dumpsys meminfo” command in PC terminal and collect the memory information.
5. Observe memory leak information in the above collected log.
step.expectedresults: 1. There should not be any memory leak when running the “CtsOpenGLTestCases”  tests in the device.

testsuite.name: Storage
testsuite.details: created test suite for storage module

testcase.name: Storage:Check device functionality to push files into internal memory
testcase.summary: Check able to push the files into internal memory
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Ethernet cable should be available and it has Internet connection.
3. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
4. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.

step.actions:
1. Connect to device through adb over Ethernet from the PC  using the command: “adb connect <DUT IP Address>”.
2. Try to push the selected file from PC to DUT internal memory using the adb command of  “adb push <file path in PC> /sdcard/”.
step.expectedresults: 1. Selected file form PC should be pushed to device internal memory after enter the command “adb push <file path in PC> /sdcard/”  In the PC terminal.

testcase.name: Storage:Check device functionality to pull files from internal memory
testcase.summary: Check able to pull the files from internal memory
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Ethernet cable should be available and it has Internet connection.
3. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
4. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.
5. Files should be existed in the device internal memory.

step.actions:
1. Connect to device through adb over Ethernet from the PC  using the command: “adb connect <DUT IP Address>”.
2. Try to pull the selected file from the device internal memory to PC using the adb command of  “adb pull  /sdcard/<filename in the device internal memory”.
step.expectedresults: 1. Specified file form the device internal memory should be pulled to PC after enter the command  “adb pull  /sdcard/<filename in the device internal memory” In the PC terminal.

testcase.name: Storage:Check device installing APK's functionality
testcase.summary: Check able to install  APKs in internal memory
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Ethernet cable should be available and it has Internet connection.
3. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
4. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.
5. Antutu benchmark should be available.

step.actions:
1. Connect to device through adb over Ethernet from the PC  using the command: “adb connect <DUT IP Address>”.
2. Try to install the Antutu benchmark in the device internal memory using the adb command of  “adb install <Antutu benchmark apk path in the PC>/”.
step.expectedresults: 1. The Antutu benchmark should be installed in the device internal memory after enter the command “adb install <Antutu benchmark apk path in the PC>/”  In the PC terminal.

testcase.name: Storage:Check device detecting USB storage functionality
testcase.summary: Check external USB storage is detecting  or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
2. USB 2.0/3.0 Pendrive should be available.

step.actions:
1. Connect the USB2.0/3.0 Pendrive to device USB host port.
2. Go to settings -> Storage -> USB disk.
3. Now check  USB 2.0/3.0 flash device is detected or not by seeing the flash drive storage properties.
step.expectedresults: 1. USB Storage should detect in USB host port and USB storage properties should show under device storage settings like available memory,total memory and etc.

testcase.name: Storage:Check USB contents are accessing or not
testcase.summary: Check able to see/access the content of the USB storage device or not in the device.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
2. USB 2.0/3.0 Pendrive should have Audio/Video/Images

step.actions:
1. Connect the USB2.0/3.0 Pendrive to device USB host port,which contains Audio/Video/Images.
2. Go to settings -> Storage -> USB disk.
3. Now check  USB 2.0/3.0 flash device is detected or not by seeing the flash drive storage properties.
4. Open Gallery application and see whether Video and Images are displaying or not. And also check audio files are showing in Music player or not.
step.expectedresults:
1. USB Storage should detect in USB host port and USB storage properties should show under device storage settings like available memory,total memory and etc.
2. Video/Images files which are there in the USB Pendrive should be displayed in the gallery and audio files should be show in Music application.

testcase.name: Storage:Check device detecting different sizes of USB storage functionality
testcase.summary: Check multiple sizes of USB storages are detecting or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
2. Multiple sizes of USB 2.0/3.0 Pendrives should be available and DUT should support them.

step.actions:
1. Connect the USB2.0/3.0 Pendrive to device USB host port.
2. Go to settings -> Storage -> USB disk.
3. Now check  USB 2.0/3.0 flash device is detected or not by seeing the flash drive storage properties.
4. Repeat the above steps from 1 to 3 by connecting the various sizes of USB Pendrives.
step.expectedresults: 1. Various sizes of USB Pendrives should detect in USB host port and USB storage properties should show under device storage settings like available memory,total memory and etc.

testcase.name: Storage:Check device functionality to delete files in internal memory
testcase.summary: Check able to delete the files which are existing in the device internal memory.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Ethernet cable should be available and it has Internet connection.
3. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
4. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.
5. Audio/Video/Images files should be available in the device internal memory.
6. Device should haven't connect any external USB storages.

step.actions:
1. Open Gallery application.
2. Click on Image/Video.
3. Select on Delete option and check whether file is deleted or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. Should be able to delete files from the gallery which are mounted with internal memory.

testcase.name: Storage:Check device functionality to uninstall third party APK's in internal memory
testcase.summary: Check able to uninstall the third party APKs from the device internal memory.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Ethernet cable should be available and it has Internet connection.
3. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
4. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.
5. Antutu benchmark should be available.

step.actions:
1. Connect to device through adb over Ethernet from the PC  using the command: “adb connect <DUT IP Address>”.
2. Install the Antutu benchmark in the device internal memory using the adb command of  “adb install <Antutu benchmark apk path in the PC>/”.
3. Long press on Antutu benchmark APK, click on “Uninstall” button on Unstall dialog and check whether Antutu benchmark is unstalled from the device internal memory.
step.expectedresults: 1. The Antutu benchmark should be uninstalled from the device internal memory after click on “Uninstall” button on the unstall dialog.

testcase.name: Storage:Check device functionality to delete files in USB storage
testcase.summary: Check able to copy  the files from internal memory to external USB storage memory
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
2. Audio/Video/Images/Text files should be available in the device internal memory.
3. USB 2.0/3.0 Pendrive should be connected to device with some files.
4. The ESFile_Explorer Apk should be installed in the device.

step.actions:
1. Open ESFile Explorer APK in the device.
2. Select any file from the device internal memory and copy it.
3. Goto External memory and try to paste the above copied file.
step.expectedresults: 1. Selected copied file from the internal memory should pasted in the external memory.

testcase.name: Storage:Check suspend/resume functionality when USB is connected
testcase.summary: Check suspend/resume functionality when USB storage is connected to device.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
2. USB 2.0/3.0 Pendrive should be available.

step.actions:
1. Connect the USB2.0/3.0 Pendrive to device USB host port.
2. Suspend the device and check whether device entered into suspend state or not.
3. Resume the device and check whether device is resumed or not and also check USB storage is functioning as expected after resume.
step.expectedresults:
1. Device should entered into suspend state when USB storage is connected to device USB host port.
2. Device should resume from suspend state successfully and also USB Storage should function as expected like USB storage should be still detected, content in the USB storage should be accessed.

testcase.name: Storage:Check copy of files from USB to internal memory
testcase.summary: Check able to copy  the files from internal memory to external USB storage memory
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
2. Audio/Video/Images/Text files should be available in the device internal memory.
3. USB 2.0/3.0 Pendrive should be connected to device with some files.
4. The ESFile_Explorer Apk should be installed in the device.

step.actions:
1. Open ESFile Explorer APK in the device.
2. Select any file from external storage which is mounted and copy it.
3. Goto internal memory and try to paste the above copied file.
step.expectedresults: 1. Selected copied file from the external memory should pasted in the device internal memory.

testcase.name: Storage:Check copy of files from internal memory to USB storage
testcase.summary: Check able to copy  the files from internal memory to external USB storage memory
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
2. Audio/Video/Images/Text files should be available in the device internal memory.
3. USB 2.0/3.0 Pendrive should be connected to device with some files.
4. The ESFile_Explorer Apk should be installed in the device.

step.actions:
1. Open ESFile Explorer APK in the device.
2. Select any file from the device internal memory and copy it.
3. Goto External memory and try to paste the above copied file.
step.expectedresults: 1. Selected copied file from the internal memory should pasted in the external memory.

testcase.name: Storage:Check internal memory mounting in PC
testcase.summary: Check device internal memory is mounted(MTP) in the PC or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
2. USB to micro cable should be available.

step.actions:
1. Connect the USB micro cable to device from the PC.
2.Click on “Transfer files(MTP)” option in the device notification bar on “Use USB for” dialog.
3. Check DUT is mounted in the the PC with “Internal storage” or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. The device Internal storage should be mounted in the PC after selecting the “Transfer files(MTP)” option in the device notification bar on “Use USB for” dialog.

testcase.name: Storage:Check transfering files from/to internal memory to/from PC using MTP
testcase.summary: Check able to transfer files to/from device internal memory from/to PC using MTP.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
2. USB to micro cable should be available.
3. Device internal memory should have accessible files.

step.actions:
1. Connect the USB micro cable to device from the PC.
2.Click on “Transfer files(MTP)” option in the device notification bar on “Use USB for” dialog.
3. After DUT is mounted in the the PC, open the device Internal storage.
4. Try to copy the selected files from internal memory to Pc.
5. And also try to copy the selected files from PC to device internal memory.
step.expectedresults: 1. After device mounted in the PC with the “Transfer files(MTP)” format, should be copy the selected files from device internal memory to PC and also should be able to copy the selected files from PC to device internal memory.

testcase.name: Storage:Check device internal memory is mounted(PTP) in PC
testcase.summary: Check device internal memory is mounted(PTP) in the PC or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
2. USB to micro cable should be available.

step.actions:
1. Connect the USB micro cable to device from the PC.
2. Click on “Transfer files(PTP)” option in the device notification bar on “Use USB for” dialog.
3. Check DUT is mounted in the the PC with “DCIM“ and “Pictures” folders of Internal storage or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. After device mounted in the PC with the “Transfer files(MTP)” format, should be copy the selected files from device internal memory to PC and also should be able to copy the selected files from PC to device internal memory.

testcase.name: Storage:Check transfering files from/to internal memory to/from PC using PTP
testcase.summary: Check able to transfer files to/from device internal memory from/to PC using PTP.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
2. USB to micro cable should be available.
3. Files should be existing in the “DCIM” or “Pictures” folders of device internal memory.

step.actions:
1. Connect the USB micro cable to device from the PC.
2. Click on “Transfer files(PTP)” option in the device notification bar on “Use USB for” dialog.
3. After DUT is mounted in the the PC, open the “DCIM” or “Pictures” folders of device Internal storage.
4. Try to copy the selected files from above mentioned folders of internal memory to Pc.
5. And also try to copy the selected files from PC to above mentioned folders of device internal memory.
step.expectedresults: 1. After device mounted in the PC with the “Transfer files(PTP)” format, should be copy the selected files from  the “DCIM” or “Pictures” folders of device internal memory to PC and wise versa.

testcase.name: Storage:Check copying a file which has more size than actual internal memory
testcase.summary: Check able to copy the file which has more size than available space in the device internal memory
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Ethernet cable should be available and it has Internet connection.
3. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
4. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.
5. Internal memory should have less space.

step.actions:
1. Connect to device through adb over Ethernet from the PC  using the command: “adb connect <DUT IP Address>”.
2. Try to push the file which size is more than the device internal memory using the adb command of  “adb push <file path in PC> /sdcard/”.
step.expectedresults: 1. File should not pushed to device when it has less memory than pushing file size.

testcase.name: Storage:Check factory reset functionality
testcase.summary: Check Factory reset functionality
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
2. Third party APKs should be installed in the device.

step.actions:
1. Goto settings->Backup & reset-> click on Factory data reset.
2. Click on “Erase” option.
step.expectedresults: 1. Device should re-start after click on “Factory reset” button and all the user data should erase.

testcase.name: Storage:Check the push/write files into internal memory are visible in Gallery/Music app or not
testcase.summary: Verify push/write files into internal memory are visible in Gallery/Music app or not
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Ethernet cable should be available and it has Internet connection.
3. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
4. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.
5. Video/Images/Audio files should be available in PC.

step.actions:
1. Connect to device through adb over Ethernet from the PC  using the command: “adb connect <DUT IP Address>”.
2. Push the Video/Image/Audio files into device from PC using the adb command of  “adb push <file path in PC> /sdcard/”.
3. Restart the device.
4. Open Gallery application and check whether Video/Images are visible or not.
5. Open Music application and check audio files are visible or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. Copied Video/Images files should show in the Gallery application and Copied Audio files should show in the Music application.

testcase.name: Storage-Str:Check to push large files to internal memory
testcase.summary: Check able to push large size files into device internal memory or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Ethernet cable should be available and it has Internet connection.
3. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
4. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.
5. Large size file should be available in the PC.

step.actions:
1. Connect to device through adb over Ethernet from the PC  using the command: “adb connect <DUT IP Address>”.
2. Try to push the large size file from PC to DUT internal memory using the adb command of  “adb push <file path in PC> /sdcard/”.
step.expectedresults: 1. Large size file should be pushed to device internal memory from PC after enter the command “adb push <file path in PC> /sdcard/”  In the PC terminal.

testcase.name: Storage-Str:Check to pull large files from internal memory
testcase.summary: Check able to pull the large size files from the internal memory
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Ethernet cable should be available and it has Internet connection.
3. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
4. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.
5. Large size files should be existed in the device internal memory.

step.actions:
1. Connect to device through adb over Ethernet from the PC  using the command: “adb connect <DUT IP Address>”.
2. Try to pull the selected large size file from the device internal memory to PC using the adb command of  “adb pull  /sdcard/<filename in the device internal memory”.
step.expectedresults: 1. Specified large size file should be pulled to PC form the device internal memory after enter the command  “adb pull  /sdcard/<filename in the device internal memory” In the PC terminal.

testcase.name: Storage-Str:Check to USB storage 25 times
testcase.summary: Connect USB storage 25 times and check each time USB storage is mounted in the device or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
2. USB 2.0/3.0 Pendrive should be available.

step.actions:
1. Connect the USB2.0/3.0 Pendrive to device USB host port.
2. Go to settings -> Storage -> USB disk.
3. Now check  USB 2.0/3.0 flash device is detected or not by seeing the flash drive storage properties.
4. Repeat the above steps from 1 to 3 for 25 times.
step.expectedresults:
For each iteration:
1. USB Storage should detect in USB host port and USB storage properties should show under device storage settings like available memory,total memory and etc.

testcase.name: Storage-Str:Check internal memory is mounted as MTP in PC or not for 25 times
testcase.summary: Check device internal memory is mounted as MTP in PC or no fro 25 times.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
2. USB to micro cable should be available.

step.actions:
1. Connect the USB micro cable to device from the PC.
2. Click on “Transfer files(MTP)” option in the device notification bar on “Use USB for” dialog.
3. Check DUT is mounted in the the PC with “Internal storage” or not.
4. Repeat the above steps from 1 to 3 for 25 times.
step.expectedresults:
For each iteration:
1. The device Internal storage should be mounted in the PC after selecting the “Transfer files(MTP)” option in the device notification bar on “Use USB for” dialog.

testcase.name: Storage-Str:Check internal memory is mounted as PTP in PC or not for 25 times
testcase.summary: Check device internal memory is mounted as PTP in PC or no fro 25 times.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
2. USB to micro cable should be available.

step.actions:
1. Connect the USB micro cable to device from the PC.
2. Click on “Transfer files(PTP)” option in the device notification bar on “Use USB for” dialog.
3. Check DUT is mounted in the the PC with “DCIM“ and “Pictures” folders of Internal storage or not.
4. Repeat the above steps from 1 to 3 for 25 times.
step.expectedresults:
For each iteration:
1. The device should be mounted in the PC with “DCIM” and “Pictures” folders of device Internal storage after selecting the “Transfer files(PTP)” option in the device notification bar on “Use USB for” dialog.

testcase.name: Storage-Conc:Check to push/pull large files into device while audio playing
testcase.summary: Check push/pull large files into device when Audio playback is going on.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Ethernet cable should be available and it has Internet connection.
3. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
4. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.
5. Large size file should be available in the PC.
6. Audio files should be available in the device.

step.actions:
1. Connect to device through adb over Ethernet from the PC  using the command: “adb connect <DUT IP Address>”.
2. Open Music player and start playback of Audio,
3. Try to push/pull the large size file from/to PC to/from DUT internal memory using the adb command of  “adb push <file path in PC> /sdcard/”.
step.expectedresults: 1. Large size file should be successfully pushed/pulled to/from device internal memory from/to PC after enter the command “adb push <file path in PC> /sdcard/”  In the PC terminal even though audio playback is going on.

testcase.name: Storage-Conc:Check to push/pull large files into device while video playing

step.actions:

2. Open Gallery application and start playback of Video.
3. Try to push/pull the large size file from/to PC to/from DUT internal memory using the adb command of  “adb push <file path in PC> /sdcard/”.
step.expectedresults: 1. Large size file should be successfully pushed/pulled to/from device internal memory from/to PC after enter the command “adb push <file path in PC> /sdcard/”  In the PC terminal even though Video playback is going on.

testcase.name: Storage-Conc:Check to push/pull large files into device while 3D Mark benchmark is running

testcase.preconditions:

2. Ethernet cable should be available and it has Internet connection.

step.actions:

step.expectedresults: 1. Large size file should be successfully pushed to device internal memory from PC after enter the command “adb push <file path in PC> /sdcard/”  in the PC terminal even though 3d Mark benchmark is running.

testcase.name: Storage-Conc:Check to push large files into device while file transfer through BT
testcase.summary: Check pushing large files to device when BT file transfer is going on.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Ethernet cable should be available and it has Internet connection.
3. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
4. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.
5. Large size file should be available in the PC.

step.actions:
1. Go to settings-> Wireless & Networks, enable the BT option.
2. Pair the DUT with another BT device.
3. Start the file transfer from one DUT to antother DUT.
4. Now try to push the large size file from PC to DUT internal memory using the adb command of  “adb push <file path in PC> /sdcard/”.
step.expectedresults: 1. Large size file should be successfully pushed to device internal memory from PC after enter the command “adb push <file path in PC> /sdcard/”  in the PC terminal even though file transfer is going on through BT to another BT device.

testcase.name: Storage-Conc:Check to push large files into device while browsing

5. WiFi module should be present in the device.

step.actions:

2. Open the browser and start browsing.
3. Now try to push the large size file from PC to DUT internal memory using the adb command of  “adb push <file path in PC> /sdcard/”.
step.expectedresults: 1. Large size file should be successfully pushed to device internal memory from PC after enter the command “adb push <file path in PC> /sdcard/”  in the PC terminal even though browsing is going on.

testcase.name: Browser:Check browse with URL's
testcase.summary: Check able to browsing with  url or not

3. Check whether the MSN website open or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. The DUT should be able to browse web sites using URL's and able to access the “www.msn.com” website.

testcase.name: Browser:Check browsing with IP address
testcase.summary: Check able to browsing with IP address or not
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android Main menu.
2. The  DUT should have the internet facility (Wi-Fi / 3G / Ethernet).

step.actions:
1. Connect the USB to USB cable to device in client mode from the PC.
2. Open the terminal in PC.
3.  Pick any known URL and IP address to test, for example“ping www.google.com”  and it will display the IP address of the “www.google.com“ website.
4. Enable the network in the device.
5. Open a Browser and enter the above displayed IP address and check whether “www.google.com” website URL is displayed or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. After entering the known website IP address in the device Browser, the device browser should access and display the relevant website URL.

testcase.name: Browser:Check downloading files

step.actions:

2. Click on search option.

4. Go to search bar and type download good morning gif, select any one of the available links.
5. Right click with mouse on any one of the file you want to download.
6. Then the download or save option will be displayed,click on that.
step.expectedresults:
1. Search results should be displayed without any issues.
2. The selected video should be downloaded.

testcase.name: Browser:Check browser to support vellamo test

testcase.name: Browser:Check browser to support 3D WebGL feature
testcase.summary: Check browser supports the “3D WebGL” feature or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot upto its android unlock screen.
2. DUT should have Ethernet or WiFi connection.
3. Chrome browser version > 25 should be available in the device.
4. Should enable “Enable WebGL” option in the chrome browser by using the “chrome://flags”.

step.actions:
1. Open Chrome browser in the device.
2. Enter “chrome://flags”  and enable the “Enable WebGL” option unger flags menu.
3. Relaunch the browser.
4. Check your browser supports the WebGL or not by entering the “ get.webgl.org” URL.
5. Enter the”https://odra.city/” url in the browser and check whether game is playing or not.
6. If the game play successfully then browser supports the 3D WebGL feature.
step.expectedresults:
1. The “Your browser supports WebGL” message should be display after entering the  url of “get.webgl.org” in the browser.
2. The 3D WebGL game should play successfully in the browser after entering the “https://odra.city/” url.

step.expectedresults: 1. DUT should download multiple files at a time using browser tabs.

testcase.name: Browser-Conc:Check browsing while playing audio
testcase.summary: Check the DUT is supporting  to play an audio file while browsing
