2. When we are browsing for latest news,the search results should be displayed without any delay.
3. At the same time the audio should be continued to play in background without any issues.

testcase.name: Browser-Conc:Check browsing while playing video
testcase.summary: Check the DUT is supporting  to play video while browsing
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot upto its android unlock screen.
2. DUT should have Ethernet or WiFi connection.
3. DUT should contain Mxplayer.
4. Supported Video files should be present in the device.

step.actions:
1. Open MXplayer app.
2. Play any video file.
3. Then  go to browser.
4. Open the browser and search for anything like latest news.
5. Click on any one of the available links.
6. After sometime close the browser and again open Mxplayer.
step.expectedresults:
1. The video should play without any issues when we start playing it.
2. When we are browsing for latest news,the search results should be displayed without any delay.
3. When we are trying to browse latest news or anything else the video should stop playing.
4. After closing the browser, when we click on Mxplayer the video should start playing.

testcase.name: Browser-Conc:Check browser to open youtube in multiple tabs
testcase.summary: Check the DUT is supporting youtube in multiple tabs or not
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot upto its android unlock screen.
2. DUT should have Ethernet or WiFi connection.

step.actions:
1. Open browser.
2. Click on search option.
3. Open  https://www.youtube.com URL.
4. Play any one of the video file.
5. open same URL in 25 tabs and play one video in one tab.
step.expectedresults:
1. Youtube window with some videos should be displayed on the screen.
2. The video should be played without any glitches and issues.
3. While switching from one tab to another tab the video should stop playing.
4. After switching from one tab to another tab  we have to click on play option to continue the video play.

testcase.name: Browser-Conc:Check adb push/pull while video streaming
testcase.summary: Check the DUT is supporting push/pull when video streaming is going on in the device.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot upto its android unlock screen.
2. DUT should have Ethernet or WiFi connection.

step.actions:
1. Open browser.
2. Open https://www.youtube.com URL.
3. Start playing any video
4. Connect the device to Ethernet IP address using the command “adb connect <IP address of the Ethernet cable>.
5. Enter the “adb push source path Destination path” command in the DUT terminal.
6. Check whether the file is copying to DUT  or not.
7. Repeat step 5 by replacing push with pull.
step.expectedresults:
1. The  video streaming  should be played  clearly with synchronization between audio and video in the browser when file is pushing/pulling to/from the device.
2. The file should be copied into DUT without any loss of data.
3. The file should be copied from  DUT without any loss of data.

testcase.name: Browser-Conc:Check browser to open youtube in multiple tabs while playing audio
testcase.summary: Check the DUT is supporting  to play audio and at the same time opening youtube in multiple tabs or not

1. DUT should boot upto its android unlock screen.
2. DUT should have Ethernet or WiFi connection.

step.actions:

2. Play any audio file.
3. Open browser.
4. Click on search option.
5. Open  https://www.youtube.com URL.
6. Play any one of the video file.
7. open same URL in 25 tabs and play one video in one tab.
step.expectedresults:
1. The audio should be audible without any disturbances.
2. The videos should be played in multiple tabs without any issues when we open that relevant tab.
3. The audio of MP3 should not be audible for us while playing video.

testsuite.name: OtherConnectivity
testsuite.details: Create test suite for Other Connectivity

testcase.name: OtherConnectivity:Check date/time update when device in active/idle state
testcase.summary: Verify date and time update functionality when the device is in active/idle state.
testcase.preconditions:
1.Target device is booted up to android main menu.
2. Radio modules should not be enabled under device settings.
3. Connect the DC to the device and stay awake option should be enabled under Developer option.

step.actions:
1.Go to "Settings -> Date & Time".
2. Uncheck the “Automatic date & time” and “Automatic time zone” options.
3. Set the current date using the "Set date" option.
4. Set the "time zone" using "Select time zone" option.
5. Set the current time using "Set time" option.
6. Set the time format i.e. 12 hours or 24 hours format using "Use 24-hour format" option.
7. Now current date & time is showing on the device notification bar as well as in settings under Date & time.
8. Keep the device in the active or idle state for some time and check whether date and time is updated or not.
step.expectedresults:
1.User defined Date should be updated on the notification bar and as well as the values should be same at set "date" option .
2. Selected time zone should be displayed at "select time zone" option .
3. Time value should be updated and that value should be same on status bar and at "set time" option.
4. Time format should be changed on status bar and at "Use 24-hour format" option according to the user action .
5. After some time, Date and Time should be updated according to user settings when the device is in active/idle state

testcase.name: OtherConnectivity:Check date and time update after power off/on the device
testcase.summary: Verify date and time update functionality after the device is powered off/on.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Install latest build into target device.
2. Target device should boot up to android main menu.
3. Radio modules should not be enabled under device settings.

step.actions:
1.Go to "Settings -> Date & Time".
2. Uncheck the “Automatic date & time” and “Automatic time zone” options.
3. Set the current date using the "Set date" option.
4. Set the "time zone" using "Select time zone" option.
5. Set the current time using "Set time" option.
6. Set the time format i.e. 12 hours or 24 hours format using "Use 24-hour format" option.
7. Now current date & time is showing on the device notification bar as well as in settings under Date & time.
8. Power off the device and wait for few minutes.
9. Power on the device and wait until device boots upto its lock screen.
10. Check whether expected/updated date and time is showing on the device notification bar or not.
step.expectedresults:
1.User defined Date should be updated on the notification bar and as well as the values should be same at set "date" option .

2. Selected time zone should be displayed at "select time zone" option.
3. Time value should be updated and that value should be same on status bar and at "set time" option.
4. Time format should be changed on status bar and at "Use 24-hour format " option according to the user action.
5. After the device power off and on, device should show the expected/updated date & time on the device notification bar.

testsuite.name: Smoke_tests

testcase.name: Boot:Check device is booting to android screen
testcase.summary: Verify whether AMD Tambourine Platform is booting to its unlock screen or not..
testcase.preconditions: 1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues

2. Verify whether AMD Tambourine platform is able to boot completely to device unlock screen or not.
step.expectedresults: After switch on the Power button, the AMD Tambourine platform should be booting to its unlock screen without any issues.

testcase.name: WiFi:Check WiFi option enable/disable

2. Enable WiFi option and verify whether WiFi option is ON or not.
3. Disable WiFi option and check whether WiFi is OFF or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. WiFi should be ON when WiFi option is checked and WiFi should be off when the WiFi option is unchecked.

testcase.name: BT:Check BlueTooth option enable/disable functionality

2. BT h/w module should be present on the device

2. Turn On Bluetooth. Verify whether it is turned ON or not.

testcase.name: 20190614-18:32:30 Display:Check DP detection
testcase.summary: Check DP is detected or not
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues. 
2. Raven board should boot upto android 
3. DP connection port should existed in the board.
4. DP display should connected to device DP port

step.actions: 1. Enter the command “ adb shell cat /sys/class/drm/card0-DP-1/status“ in pc terminal and check whether “connected” message is displaying or not. If  “connected” message is displayed then DP detected otherwise it is not detected.
step.expectedresults: 1. When the DP cable is connected the device and after entering the “ adb shell cat /sys/class/drm/card0-DP-1/status” command in PC terminal then “connected” message should be displayed.

testsuite.name: Sanity_tests
testsuite.details: Created test suite for sanity

testcase.name: Boot:Check binaries flashing on device
testcase.summary: Check flashing of binaries into DUT functionality.
testcase.preconditions:
1. ISO image should be available in pc for flashing.
2. Raven board with hard disk should be available.
3. “Unetbootin” tool should be available in PC.

step.actions:
1. Connect the USB storage drive in PC.
2. Open “Unetbootin “ tool.
3. Select “ISO” option under “Diskimage”  drop down box and select the “Diskimage” radio button.
4. Choose the ISO image from pc by browse and click on “OK” button. Once flashing done press on exit button.
5. Connect the USB flash drive to DUT USB port which is having the ISO image.
6. Power on the device, press on F12 button after power on the device.
7. Select the”Auto_Installation – Auto Install to specified harddisk” option.
8. Select the Installer source option which you want to install.
9. Select  the “Yes” button on “Auto Installer” dialog.
10. check whether installation is success or not.
step.expectedresults:
1. The “ISO” image should be flashed into expected USB storage.
2. Should be able to select the “Auto_Installation – Auto Install to specified harddisk” option.
3. Image should be flashed into DUT using Auto installer option on specified source.

testcase.name: Boot:Check device is booting to android screen
testcase.summary: Verify whether AMD Tambourine Platform is booting to its unlock screen or not..
testcase.preconditions: 1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues

step.actions:
1. Switch on the device by using power button.
2. Verify whether AMD Tambourine platform is able to boot completely to device unlock screen or not.
step.expectedresults: After switch on the Power button, the AMD Tambourine platform should be booting to its unlock screen without any issues.

testcase.name: Display:Check DP detection
testcase.summary: Check DP is detected or not
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues. 
2. Raven board should boot upto android 
3. DP connection port should existed in the board.
4. DP display should connected to device DP port

step.actions: 1. Enter the command “ adb shell cat /sys/class/drm/card0-DP-1/status“ in pc terminal and check whether “connected” message is displaying or not. If  “connected” message is displayed then DP detected otherwise it is not detected.
step.expectedresults: 1. When the DP cable is connected the device and after entering the “ adb shell cat /sys/class/drm/card0-DP-1/status” command in PC terminal then “connected” message should be displayed.

testcase.name: Display:Check DP display
testcase.summary: Check DP display is coming or not after power on the device
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. DP connection port should be there on the board.

step.actions:
1.Connect the DP display to the device DP port.

2. Power on the device and check the display screen.
step.expectedresults: 1.Board should bootup properly with out any issues and there should not be screen corruptions or hangs. DP display screen should be shown properly without any issues.

testcase.name: Ethernet:Check Ethernet detection
testcase.summary: Check the Ethernet detection functionality.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Ethernet cable should be available and it has Internet connection.
3. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
4. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.

step.actions: 1. Check whether Ethernet cable is detected or not by looking at the Ethernet port. If the cable is detected  then LED light will blink at the port.
step.expectedresults: The Ethernet cable should detect

testcase.name: Ethernet:Check Ethernet connection and disconnection
testcase.summary: Verify Ethernet Connect and Disconnect functionality
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Ethernet cable should be available and it has Internet connection.
3. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.

step.actions:
1. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.
2. Check whether Ethernet cable is detected or not by looking at the Ethernet port. If the cable is detected  then LED light will blink at the port. 
3. Disconnect Ethernet Cable from the Raven Board Ethernet port.
4. Check again whether the LED at Ethernet port is OFF or not.
5.Enter ifconfig command on the DUT after disconnection.
step.expectedresults:
1&2. The Ethernet cable should detect and LED should Blink/ON  when the Ethernet cable is connected to device Ethernet port and should able to ping "google.co.in successfully." 
 
3&4. The Ethernet LED should OFF when the Ethernet cable is disconnected from the Ethernet port.
5.IP address should not be configured to the DUT after disconnection of ethernet.

testcase.name: Ethernet:Check browsing with Ethernet
testcase.summary: Verify whether the system is able to browse with Ethernet
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Dynamic IP should configured to DUT.
3. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.

step.actions:
1. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.
2. Check whether Ethernet cable is detected or not by looking at the Ethernet port. If the cable is detected  then LED light will blink at the port. 
3. Open browser and try to access some web sites.
step.expectedresults:
1. Ethernet cable should detect when it is connected to device Ethernet port. 
2&3.System should be able to browse the internet without any issues

testcase.name: Ethernet:Check adb over Ethernet
testcase.summary: Verify whether the DUT support to adb over Ethernet functionality or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Ethernet cable should be available and it has Internet connection.
3. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
4. Should have Host PC.
5. should have the DUT IP Address

step.actions:
1. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.
2. Check whether Ethernet cable is detected or not by looking at the Ethernet port. If the cable is detected  then LED light will blink at the port. 
3. Open “Terminal Emulator” Apk on DUT.
4. Run “su” command on DUT terminal.
5. Run “setprop service.adb.tcp.port 5555” command on DUT terminal.
6. Run “stop adbd” command on DUT terminal.
7. Run “start adbd” command on DUT terminal.
8. Now open terminal in Host PC and Run “adb connect <DUT IP Address> ”.
9. Check whether the DUT is enumerated in PC or not by entering the  "adb devices" command in PC terminal.
step.expectedresults:
1. The Ethernet cable should detect and LED should Blink/ON  when the Ethernet cable is connected to device Ethernet port . 
2. The “adb connect <DUT IP Address>” command should show the “Connected to <DUT IP Address>”
3. The DUT should show under the “adb devices” list.

testcase.name: USB:Check USB Keyboard detection
testcase.summary: Check the USB Keyboard Functionality
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. USB should work as a host.

step.actions:
1.Connect the USB Keyboard to USB port on the device and then power on the System.
2.Press F12 or DEL to enter into BIOS settings/Boot Menu.
3.After bootup,Open any notepad kind of application and enter all the keys,check the functionality.
step.expectedresults:
1. USB should detect properly without any issues.
2.Keyboard should work properly without any issues and system should enter into BIOS/BootMenu.
3.All keys in the Keyboard should work properly without any issues.

testcase.name: USB:Check USB Mouse detection
testcase.summary: Check the USB Mouse Functionality
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. USB should work as a host.

step.actions:
1.Connect the USB Keyboard to USB port on the device and then power on the System.
2.Press F12 or DEL to enter into BIOS settings/Boot Menu and use Mouse to select different options.
3.After bootup,Use mouse options(Leftclick and Right click ,etc.,) to open application and perform actions.
step.expectedresults:
1. USB should detect properly without any issues.
2.Keyboard And Mouse should work properly without any issues.
3.Mouse functionality should work properly without any issues.

testcase.name: USB:Check USB storage detection
testcase.summary: Check the USB Storage device Functionality
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
3. USB should work as a host.

step.actions:
1. Connect a USB storage device (e.g.: USB 2.0/3.0 Flash device/Pen drives) to USB host port.
2. Go to settings -> Storage -> USB disk.
3. Now check whether USB 2.0 flash device is detected or not with out any issues. .
step.expectedresults: 1. USB Storage should detect in USB host port and also device display screen should not rotate when the USB 2.0 devices connected to host port.USb storage device data should display properly without any issues.

testcase.name: WiFi:Check WiFi option enable/disable
testcase.summary: Verify WiFi option enabling/disabling functionality
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Wi-Fi functionality should be supported in the build
3. WiFi module should be present on device.

step.actions:
1. Go to Settings->Wireless & networks->Wi-Fi settings
2. Enable WiFi option and verify whether WiFi option is ON or not.
3. Disable WiFi option and check whether WiFi is OFF or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. WiFi should be ON when WiFi option is checked and WiFi should be off when the WiFi option is unchecked.

testcase.name: WiFi:Check WiFi scan functionality
testcase.summary: Verify whether device is able to scan and show all the available supported WiFi frequency networks or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Wi-Fi functionality should be supported in the build
3. WiFi module should be present on device.

step.actions:
1. Enable Wi-Fi option on DUT
2. Verify whether Wi-Fi is able to scan and show all the supported frequency bands available networks when the WiFi option is enabled.
step.expectedresults: 1. Wi-Fi should scan and show all the supported frequency bands available networks when the WiFi option is enabled.

testcase.name: BT:Check BlueTooth option enable/disable functionality
testcase.summary: Verify Turn ON/OFF of Bluetooth functionality
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. BT h/w module should be present on the device

step.actions:
1. Go to settings > wireless & networks > Bluetooth 
2. Turn On Bluetooth. Verify whether it is turned ON or not. 
3. Turn OFF Bluetooth. Check whether it is turned OFF or not
step.expectedresults: 1. BT should be turned ON when enabling the BT option and it should be turned OFF when the BT option is unchecked

testcase.name: BT:Check Bluettoth scan functionality
testcase.summary: Verify Scan for devices functionality.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. BT h/w module should be present on the device

step.actions:
1. Go to settings > Wireless & Networks > Bluetooth Settings 
2. Turn On Bluetooth.
3. Turn on Bluetooth in other device and make it as discoverable by other Bluetooth devices
4. Select scan for the devices to check for the available Bluetooth devices around.
5. Turn on Bluetooth in some other device and make sure it is discoverable by other devices. 
6. Select "scan for devices" in DUT.
step.expectedresults: 1. on selecting "scan for devices", device should run the scan again and the available device list should refresh and show the list.

testcase.name: BT:Check BT is pairing to FTP device
testcase.summary: Pair and Connect to FTP Device
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. BT h/w module should be present on the device

step.actions:
1. Go to settings > Wireless & Networks > Bluetooth Settings 
2. Turn On Bluetooth.
3. Check the "discoverable" option.
4. Turn the Bluetooth on on another FTP device and make sure it is discoverable
5. Scan for the Bluetooth devices around
6. Pair with another FTP device 
7. Check for any issues.
step.expectedresults: 1. DUT should be paired and connected with another FTP device.

testcase.name: OtherConnectivity:Check Airplane mode option enable/disable functionality
testcase.summary: Verify whether system is able to enable and disable Airplane mode or not.
testcase.preconditions: 1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu

step.actions:
1. Goto settings.
2. Goto wireless & network settings → More.
3. Check whether system is able to enable the Airplane option or not. And also check whether able to disable the Airplane option or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. Should be able to enable/disable the Airplane option.

testcase.name: OtherConnectivity:Check date/time update when device in active/idle state
testcase.summary: Verify date and time update functionality when the device is in active/idle state.
testcase.preconditions:
1.Target device is booted up to android main menu.
2. Radio modules should not be enabled under device settings.
3. Connect the DC to the device and stay awake option should be enabled under Developer option.

step.actions:
1.Go to "Settings -> Date & Time".
2. Uncheck the “Automatic date & time” and “Automatic time zone” options.
3. Set the current date using the "Set date" option.
4. Set the "time zone" using "Select time zone" option.
5. Set the current time using "Set time" option.
6. Set the time format i.e. 12 hours or 24 hours format using "Use 24-hour format" option.
7. Now current date & time is showing on the device notification bar as well as in settings under Date & time.
8. Keep the device in the active or idle state for some time and check whether date and time is updated or not.
step.expectedresults:
1.User defined Date should be updated on the notification bar and as well as the values should be same at set "date" option .
2. Selected time zone should be displayed at "select time zone" option .
3. Time value should be updated and that value should be same on status bar and at "set time" option.
4. Time format should be changed on status bar and at "Use 24-hour format" option according to the user action .
5. After some time, Date and Time should be updated according to user settings when the device is in active/idle state

testcase.name: Multimedia:Check Audeo decode functionality of .mp3 format
testcase.summary: Verify whether the DUT is supporting the Playback of MP3(.mp3) Audio format or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot DUT up to Android Main menu.
2. Should be available the MP3(.mp3) audio codec format files

step.actions:
1. Copy the MP3(.mp3) Audio decode format file into the device.
2. Open the Music Apk.
3. Select and Playback the above copied file from the device and Check whether DUT is playing audio file without any issues or not.
step.expectedresults: 1.The DUT should support the Playback of MP3(.mp3) Audio format without any issues.

testcase.name: Multimedia:Check Audio decode functionality of .wav format
testcase.summary: Verify whether the DUT is supporting the Playback of PCM/WAVE(.wav) Audio format or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot DUT up to Android Main menu.
2. Should be available the PCM/WAVE(.wav) audio codec file.

step.actions:
1. Copy the WAVE(.wav) audio codec format file into the device.
2. Open the Music Apk.
3. Select and Playback the above copied file from the device and Check whether DUT is playing without any issues or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. The DUT should support the Playback of WAVE(.wav) Audio decode format file without any issues.

testcase.name: Multimedia:Check H263 video codec with 3GPP container
testcase.summary: Verify whether DUT is supporting the H.263 Video codec format with the 3GPP(.3gp) container files or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot the DUT up to Android Main menu.
2. The H.263 video codec supported files of .3gp container should be available for testing.

step.actions:
1. Copy the H.263 video codec supported of the .3gp container files into the device.
2. Open the Gallery Apk.
3. Select and Playback the above copied files from the device and check whether they are playing without any issues or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. The device should playback the H.263 video codec supported of the .3gp container files without any issues.

testcase.name: Multimedia:Check H264 video codec with .mp4 container
testcase.summary: Verify whether DUT is supporting the H.264 AVC video codec with the container of .mp4 files or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot the DUT up to Android Main menu.
2. The H.264 AVC video codec supported files of .mp4 container should be available for testing.

step.actions:
1. Copy the H.264 AVC video codec supported of the .mp4 container files  into the device.
2. Open the Gallery Apk.
3. Playback the above copied files from the device and check whether they are playing without any issues or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. The device should playback the H.264 AVC video codec supported of the .mp4 container files without any issues.

testcase.name: Multimedia:Check JPEG decode functionality
testcase.summary: Verify whether DUT is supporting the JPEG image decode format or not:
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot the DUT up to Android Main menu.
2. The JPEG image format should be available for testing.

step.actions:
1. Copy the image of JPEG format into the device.
2. Open Gallery Apk.
2. Open the above copied image from the device and check whether image is clearly visible or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. The image of JPEG formate file should be open and show without any issues.

testcase.name: Multimedia:Check PNG decode functionality
testcase.summary: Verify whether DUT is supporting the PNG image decode format or not:
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot the DUT up to Android Main menu.
2. The PNG image format should be available for testing.

step.actions:
1. Copy the image of PNG format into the device.
2. Open Gallery Apk.
2. Open the above copied image from the device and check whether image is clearly visible or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. The image of PNG formate file should be open and show without any issues.

testcase.name: PowerSuspendResume:Check device suspend/resume functionality
testcase.summary: Check the Display after Suspend and Resume
testcase.preconditions: 1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.

step.actions:
1.Connect the HDMI display to the board and then power on the board. Check the display screen.
2. Disable the stay awake option in developer options
3. Set the wake time in display to 15 seconds
4.Suspend and resume the DUT then check the Display.
step.expectedresults: DUT Should enter into the sleep mode and display screen becomes blank and also device should resume from suspend state properly,Display screen should shown properly without any issues.

testcase.name: Graphics:Check 3D graphics tests
testcase.summary: Check whether 3D graphic tests are playing or not
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2. The “AnTuTu3DBench-com.antutu.benchmark.full-6000400-v6.0.4.apk” benchmark should be available.

step.actions:
1. Install the “AnTuTu3DBench-com.antutu.benchmark.full-6000400-v6.0.4.apk” in the device.                                                                2. Open the above installed apk.
3. Check whether 3D graphics tests(Marooned and Garden) are playing or not.
step.expectedresults: The antutu 3D graphics tests should be played without any lagging.

testcase.name: Graphics:Check OpenGL ES3.1 tests in 3D Mark
testcase.summary: Check OpenGL ES3.1 tests in 3D Mark
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2. The “3D Mark benchmark should be available.

step.actions:
1. Install the “3D Mark benchmark" apk in the device.                                                                2. Open the above installed apk.
3. Play the OpenGL ES3.1 graphics tests and check colors or graphics of the images are visible clear or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. All the OpenGL ES3.1 Graphics tests should play without any corruptions.

testcase.name: Camera:Check able to capture an image
testcase.summary: Check whether Camera is able to capture image
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Camera functionality should be supported in the build

step.actions: 1 Select camera icon available in home screen 2.Try to capture the image in Normal mode.       3.Check whether proper image is captured and stored in the respective folder in sdcard.
step.expectedresults: Image should be captured and stored in the respective folder in sdcard.

testcase.name: Camera:Check video recording functionality
testcase.summary: Check whether Camera supports video recording feature
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Camera functionality should be supported in the build

step.actions:
1 Select camera icon available in home screen
2.Select video recording option and try recording video of the objects.                                  
3.Check whether proper video is recorded and stored in the respective folder in sdcard.
step.expectedresults: Image of distant objects should be captured properly and stored in the respective folder in sdcard.

testcase.name: Boot:Check device booting after hardshutdown
testcase.summary: Check whether device is re-booting properly or not after abruptly power off it.
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues. 
2. Raven board should boot upto android.

step.actions:
1.While operating the device i.e. while video playback, during browsing, power off the device using power button.
2. Now power on the device and check whether DUT is booting to android lock screen or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. After power off the device, while operating the device, i.e. during video playback or browsing, device should boot upto android lock screen after power on.

testcase.name: Display:Check HDMI display
testcase.summary: Check the HDMI Display after power on the board.
testcase.preconditions: 1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.

step.actions: 1.Connect the HDMI display to the board and then power on the board. Check the display screen.
step.expectedresults: 1.Board should bootup properly with out any issues and there should not be screen corruptions or hangs. Display screen should be shown properly without any issues.

testcase.name: Display:Check HDMI cable detection
testcase.summary: Check whether HDMI is detecting or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues. 
2. Raven board should boot upto android 
3. HDMI cable should be connected to the board.

step.actions: 1. Enter the command “ adb shell cat /sys/class/drm/card0-HDMI-A-1/status“ in pc terminal and check whether “connected” message is displaying or not. If  “connected” message is displayed then HDMI is detected otherwise it is not detected.
step.expectedresults: 1. When the HDMI cable is connected the device and after entering the “ adb shell cat /sys/class/drm/card0-HDMI-A-1/status” command in PC terminal then “connected” message should be displayed.

testcase.name: Display:Check HDMI display after suspend/resume
testcase.summary: Check the HDMI Display after Suspend and Resume
testcase.preconditions: 1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.

step.actions:
1.Connect the HDMI display to the board and then power on the board. Check the display screen.
2.Suspend and resume the DUT then check the Display.
step.expectedresults:
1.Board should bootup properly with out any issues and there should not be screen corruptions or hangs.
2.DUT Should enter into the sleep and resume properly,Display screen should shown properly without any issues.

testcase.name: Display:Check HDMI hot-plugin and hot-plugout
testcase.summary: Check the Hot-plug and Hot-unplug of the HDMI Display
testcase.preconditions: 1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.

step.actions:
1.Connect the HDMI display to the board and then power on the board. Check the display screen.
2.Remove the HDMI cable on the board.
3.Connect the HDMI cable again to the board.
step.expectedresults:
1.Board should bootup properly with out any issues and there should not be screen corruptions or hangs.
2&3.Display should off after disconnecting the cable without any corruptions and display should shown properly after connecting the device again.

testcase.name: Display:Check detection of different resolutions
testcase.summary: Check whether DUT is detecting different resolution displays or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Working binaries should be copied into device.
2. Different resolution displays i.e. DP displays should be available for testing.

step.actions:
1.Connect the DP display to the board and then power on the board. Check the display screen.
2. Repeat the above step with different resolutions.
step.expectedresults: 1. DUT should detect different resolution displays connected to it and it should show properly without any issues i.e. corruptions

testcase.name: WiFi:Check able to enable/disable the portable WiFi hotspot option
testcase.summary: Verify whether user is able to enable/disable the Portable Wi-Fi hotspot option  or not
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Wi-Fi functionality should be supported in the build
3. WiFi module should be present on device.

step.actions:
1. Goto "settings -> Wireless and networks ->Tethering & portable hotspot.
2. Select the Portable Wi-Fi hotspot option and check whether hotspot option is enabled or not and also check whether hotspot symbol is showing on the device status bar or not.
3. Deselect the WiFi hotspot option and check whether hotspot option is disappeared from the device status bar or not.
step.expectedresults:
1. WiFi hotspot option should be enabled when it is selected and also hotspot symbol should be shown on the device status bar.
2. WiFi hotspot option should be disabled when it is deselected and also hotspot symbol should disappear from the device status bar.

testcase.name: WiFi:Check able to enable/disable the portable WiFi hotspot option 10 times
testcase.summary: Verify whether user is able to enable/disable the Portable WiFi hotspot option 10 times or not
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Wi-Fi functionality should be supported in the build
3. WiFi module should be present on device.

step.actions:
1. Goto "settings -> Wireless and networks ->Tethering & portable hotspot.
2. Select the Portable Wi-Fi hotspot option and check whether hotspot option is enabled or not and also check whether hotspot symbol is showing on the device status bar or not.
3. Deselect the WiFi hotspot option and check whether hotspot option is disappeared from the device status bar or not.
4. Repeat the above steps from the 2 to 3 for 10 times.
step.expectedresults:
1. WiFi hotspot option should be enabled when it is selected and also hotspot symbol should be shown on the device status bar for each iteration
2. WiFi hotspot option should be disabled when it is un selected and also hotspot symbol should be disappear from the device status bar for each iteration

testcase.name: WiFi:Check able to turn-on WiFi when Airplane option is in enabled state
testcase.summary: When the system in Air plane mode, check whether Wi-Fi is able to turned ON/OFF or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Wi-Fi functionality should be supported in the build
3. WiFi module should be present on device.
4. Connected router should have Internet.

step.actions:
1.Go to Settings->More->Aeroplane mode and enable aeroplane mode                                         2. Go to Settings->Wireless & networks->Wi-Fi settings
3. Enable WiFi option and verify whether WiFi option is ON or not.                                                   4.Check whether WiFi listed all the available WiFi networks 
5. Connect to  a WiFi network by proving proper authentication                                                             6.Check whether the device is able to browse any URL in Browser app.
step.expectedresults: WIFI should be ON , connected to the network and should be able to browse URLs even when aeroplane mode is enabled.

testcase.name: BT:Check able to turn-on BT when Airplane option is in enabled state
testcase.summary: When the system in Air plane mode, check whether BT is able to turned ON/OFF or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. BT h/w module should be present on the device

step.actions:
1.  Go-to settings - > Wireless & Networks → More → enable the Air plane mode option.
2. Now the system is in Airplane mode.
3. Goto → Settings → select the Bluetooth option and check whether BT option is enabled or not..
4. Un-select the Bluetooth option and check whether BT option is disabled or not.
step.expectedresults:
1. When the system in Airplane mode, and after click on Bluetooth option, the BT option should be enabled.
2. When un-select the Bluetooth option, the BT option should be disabled.

testcase.name: Multimedia:Check Playback of AAC LC Audio codec in .3gp container
testcase.summary:
Verify whether the DUT is supporting the Playback of AAC LC Audio codec format with the following channels, sampling rates and containers:
a) Mono channel with 8 kHz, 24 kHz and 48 kHz sample rates in .3gp container.
b) Stereo channel with 8 kHz, 24 kHz and 48 kHz sample rates in .3gp container.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot the DUT up to Android Main menu.
2. The AAC LC Audio codec format with the following channels, sampling rates and container files should be available for testing.
a) Mono/Stereo channels with 8 kHz, 24 kHz and 48 kHz sample rates in .3gp container should be kept ready.

step.actions:
1. Copy the AAC LC Audio codec format with the following channels, sampling rates and container files into the device:
a) Mono/Stereo channels with 8 kHz, 24 kHz and 48 kHz sample rates in .3gp container.
2. Open the Gallery Apk.
3. Select and playback the above copied audio codec files.
4. Check whether DUT is supporting the above copied Audio codec files or not.
step.expectedresults:
The DUT should support the playback of AAC LC Audio codec format with the following channels, sampling rates and containers without any issues:

testcase.name: PowerSuspendResume-Str:Check device suspend/resume functionality 20 times
testcase.summary: Check the Display after Suspend and Resume for 20 times
testcase.preconditions: 1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.

step.actions:
1.Connect the HDMI display to the board and then power on the board. Check the display screen.
2. Disable the stay awake option in developer options
3. Set the wake time in display to 15 seconds
4.Suspend and resume the DUT for 10 to 15 times and check the Display.
step.expectedresults: DUT Should enter into the sleep mode and display screen becomes blank and also device should resume from suspend state properly,Display screen should shown properly without any issues.

testcase.name: Graphics:Check graphics performance
testcase.summary: Check the graphics performance
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2. The “NenaMark2-se.nena.nenamark2-5-v2.4.apk benchmark should be available.

step.actions:
1. Install the “NenaMark2-se.nena.nenamark2-5-v2.4.apk” in the device.                                          2. Open the above installed apk.
3. Run the test and check graphics performance in FPS.
step.expectedresults: 1. The “Nena mark” test should be played without any lagging and also graphics value in FPS should be good as expected.

testcase.name: Graphics:Check 3D graphics tests in 3D Mark
testcase.summary: Check whether all the 3D graphics tests are playing without any issues or not in 3D Mark .
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu.
2. The “3D Mark-the gammers bench mark apk”  should be available.

step.actions:
1. Install the “3D Mark(android_gammers_com.futuremark.dmandroid.application_2.0.4580-4580.apk)-the gammers benchmark” in the device.
2. Open the above installed apk.
3. Playback the 3D Mark slingshot extreme and slingshot extreme unlimitted testsand check all are playing without any corruptions or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. All the tests in Slingshot extreme and slingshot exreme unlimitted tests in 3D mark should be played without any corruptions.

testcase.name: OtherConnectivity:Check Airplane mode option enable/disable functionality
testcase.summary: Verify whether system is able to enable and disable Airplane mode or not.
testcase.preconditions: 1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu

step.actions:
1. Goto settings.
2. Goto wireless & network settings → More.
3. Check whether system is able to enable the Airplane option or not. And also check whether able to disable the Airplane option or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. Should be able to enable/disable the Airplane option.

testcase.name: OtherConnectivity:Check browse with URLs
testcase.summary: Verify whether the DUT is able to browse web sites using URL's or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android Main menu
2. The  DUT should have the internet facility (Wi-Fi / 3G / Ethernet)

step.actions:
1.Open the Browser Apk,
2. Open the “www.msn.com” URL.
3. Check whether the MSN website open or not
step.expectedresults: The DUT should be able to browse web sites using URL's and able to access the “www.msn.com” website.

testcase.name: OtherConnectivity:Check browse with IP address
testcase.summary: Verify whether the DUT is able to browse web sites using IP addresses  or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android Main menu
2. The  DUT should have the internet facility (Wi-Fi / 3G / Ethernet)

step.actions:
1. Connect the USB to USB cable to device in client mode from the PC.
2. Open the terminal in PC.
3.  Pick any known URL and IP address to test, for example“ping www.google.com”  and it will display the IP address of the “www.google.com“ website. 
4. Enable the network in the device.
5. Open a Browser and enter the above displayed IP address and check whether “www.google.com” website URL is displayed or not.
step.expectedresults: 1.After entering the known website IP address in the device Browser, the device browser should access and display the relevant website URL.

testcase.name: OtherConnectivity:Check playback of Audio streaming
testcase.summary: Verify whether the DUT is able to play streaming audio or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android Main menu
2. The  DUT should have the internet facility (Wi-Fi / 3G / Ethernet)

step.actions:
1.Open the Browser Apk,
2. Open the “https://gaana.com/” URL.
3. Play any Audio.
4. Check whether the Audio is playing without any issues or not
step.expectedresults: The DUT should be able to play streaming audio with out any issues.

testcase.name: OtherConnectivity:Check playback of Video streaming
testcase.summary: Verify whether the DUT is able to play streaming video or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android Main menu
2. The  DUT should have the internet facility (Wi-Fi / 3G / Ethernet)

step.actions:
1.Open the Browser Apk,
2. Open the “https://m.youtube.com” URL.
3. Play any Video.
4. Check whether the video is playing without any issues or not
step.expectedresults: The DUT should be able to play streaming video with out any issues.

testcase.name: OtherConnectivity:Check DUT able to get network time
testcase.summary: Verify whether the DUT is able to get network time or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android Main menu
2. The  DUT should have the internet facility (Wi-Fi / 3G / Ethernet)

step.actions:
1. Disable the WiFi/3G/Ethernet options.
2. Go to Settings → Date & time.
3. Disable the “Automatic date & time” and set the incorrect time in the device.
4. Enable the WiFi/3G/Ethernet in the device.
5. Enable the “Automatic date & time” option under “Date & time” settings.
6. Check whether correct time is showing by the device or not by using the network.
step.expectedresults: The DUT should be updated to correct time using network when the device has incorrect time.

testcase.name: OtherConnectivity:Check Ethernet given high priority than WiFi
testcase.summary: Verify Ethernet is given high priority than WiFi or not
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Ethernet cable should be there and it has Internet connection.
3. Boot the device completely to its unlock screen.
4. WiFi should work.

step.actions:
1. Go to settings → Enable WiFi and connect to router.
2. Connect the Ethernet cable which is having internet. 
3. Verify whether WiFi is got disconnected or not.
4. Now disconnect the Ethernet cable from device and check whether WiFi is automatically connected to previously connected APN.
step.expectedresults:
1. When Ethernet cable connected to device then WiFi should be disconnect because Ethernet is high priority than WiFi.
2. When Ethernet  is disconnect from the device then WiFi should be automatically connected to previously connected APN.

testcase.name: OtherConnectivity:Check WiFi is turned off/on when Airplane mode is turned on/off
testcase.summary: Verify whether WiFi is turned off/on when the  Airplane mode is on/off or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot DUT up to Android Main menu.
2. WiFi should be enabled in the build.

step.actions:
1. Goto settings.
2. Goto wireless & network settings.
3. Enable WiFi and connect it to known APN.
4. Enable Airplane mode option and check whether WiFi is turned off or not.
5. Disable Airplane mode option and check whether WiFi is enabled and reconnected to its previously connected APN.
step.expectedresults: 1. WiFi  should be turned OFF when airplane mode is enabled and WiFi should be turned ON when airplane mode goes to disable mode and also WiFi should be reconnected to its previously connected APN.

testcase.name: OtherConnectivity:Check BT is turned off/on when Airplane mode is turned on/off
testcase.summary: Verify whether BT is turned off/on when the  Airplane mode is on/off or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot DUT up to Android Main menu.
2. BT should be enabled in the build.

step.actions:
1. Goto settings.
2. Goto wireless & network settings.
3. Enable BT option.
4. Enable Airplane mode option and check whether BT is turned off or not.
5. Disable Airplane mode option and check whether BT option is re-enabled or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. BT  should be turned OFF when airplane mode is enabled and BT should be turned ON when airplane mode goes to disable mode.

testcase.name: OtherConnectivity:Check both WiFi and BT are turned off/on when Airplane mode is turned on/off
testcase.summary: Verify whether both WiFi and BT modules are turned off/on when the  Airplane mode is on/off or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot DUT up to Android Main menu.
2. WiFi and BT should be enabled in the build.

step.actions:
1. Goto settings.
2. Goto wireless & network settings.
3. Enable WiFi and connect it to known APN.
4. Enable  BT.
5. Enable Airplane mode option and check whether WiFi and Bt modules are off or not.
6. Disable Airplane mode option and check whether WiFi is enabled and reconnected to its previously connected APN or not and also check Whether BT is re-enabled or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. WiFi and BT  should be turned OFF when airplane mode is enabled and they should be turned ON when airplane mode goes to disable mode and also WiFi should be reconnected to its previously connected APN.

testsuite.name: Performance
testsuite.details: Create test suite for performance

testcase.name: Boot-Per:Check boot time
testcase.summary: Check the warm Boot time of the DUT
testcase.preconditions: 1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.

step.actions:
1. Switch on the device by using power button but keep in mind, this is not the firm time boot after flashing the binaries. 
2. Calculate the time taken for the device to boot from startup to android lock screen.
step.expectedresults: The DUT warm Boot time should not take more than 1 min  and display should appear properly without any issues.

testcase.name: Boot-Per:Check device cold boot time
testcase.summary: Check the DUT cold boot time
testcase.preconditions: 1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.

step.actions:
1. Switch on the device by using power button.
2. Calculate the time taken for the device to boot from startup to android lock screen.
step.expectedresults: 1. The DUT Cold Boot time should not take more than 1 min  and display should appear properly without any issues.

testcase.name: SuspendResume-Per:Check device wakeup time.
testcase.summary: Check device wakeup time from suspend state.
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
2. Power cable with adopter should be available and it should be connected to power source.
3. Display should be connected to device.
4. Device should boot upto android unlock screen

step.actions:
1.Suspend the device
2. Try to resume the device using keyboard and mouse.
3. Check time taken for the device to wake from suspend state.
step.expectedresults: Device should wake up from suspend state within 5 seconds.

testcase.name: Multimedia:Check time for video playback formats
testcase.summary: Verify time taken to start Video playback for each format supported
testcase.preconditions:

2. Build should support playback of Video and Audio streams

step.actions:
1. Copy all different video streams to DUT
2. Open galley.
3. Select any video file and calculate time taken to playback the video.
step.expectedresults: 1.Video playback should start within 2 seconds

testcase.name: 20190425-10:12:52 WiFi:Check WiFi scan functionality
testcase.summary: Verify whether device is able to scan and show all the available supported WiFi frequency networks or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Wi-Fi functionality should be supported in the build
3. WiFi module should be present on device.

step.actions:
1. Enable Wi-Fi option on DUT
2. Verify whether Wi-Fi is able to scan and show all the supported frequency bands available networks when the WiFi option is enabled.
step.expectedresults: 1. Wi-Fi should scan and show all the supported frequency bands available networks when the WiFi option is enabled.

testcase.name: 20190425-10:11:12 Display:Check DP detection
testcase.summary: Check DP is detected or not
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues. 
2. Raven board should boot upto android 
3. DP connection port should existed in the board.
4. DP display should connected to device DP port

step.actions: 1. Enter the command “ adb shell cat /sys/class/drm/card0-DP-1/status“ in pc terminal and check whether “connected” message is displaying or not. If  “connected” message is displayed then DP detected otherwise it is not detected.
step.expectedresults: 1. When the DP cable is connected the device and after entering the “ adb shell cat /sys/class/drm/card0-DP-1/status” command in PC terminal then “connected” message should be displayed.

testcase.name: 20190425-10:08:19 USB:Check USB storage detection
testcase.summary: Check the USB Storage device Functionality
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
3. USB should work as a host.

step.actions:
1. Connect a USB storage device (e.g.: USB 2.0/3.0 Flash device/Pen drives) to USB host port.
2. Go to settings -> Storage -> USB disk.
3. Now check whether USB 2.0 flash device is detected or not with out any issues. .
step.expectedresults: 1. USB Storage should detect in USB host port and also device display screen should not rotate when the USB 2.0 devices connected to host port.USb storage device data should display properly without any issues.

testcase.name: 20190425-10:07:48 Ethernet:Check browsing with Ethernet
testcase.summary: Verify whether the system is able to browse with Ethernet
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Dynamic IP should configured to DUT.
3. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.

step.actions:
1. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.
2. Check whether Ethernet cable is detected or not by looking at the Ethernet port. If the cable is detected  then LED light will blink at the port. 
3. Open browser and try to access some web sites.
step.expectedresults:
1. Ethernet cable should detect when it is connected to device Ethernet port. 
2&3.System should be able to browse the internet without any issues

testcase.name: 20190425-10:04:16 Multimedia:Check Audio decode functionality of .wav format
testcase.summary:
Check the DUT is supporting the playback of WAVE(.wav) Audio format with the following sample rates or not.
a).8-bit linear PCM with sampling rate 8000HZ.
b).8-bit linear PCM with sampling rate 16000HZ.
c).8-bit linear PCM with sampling rate 44100HZ.
d).8-bit linear PCM with sampling rate 48000HZ.
e).16-bit linear PCM with sampling rate 8000HZ
f).16-bit linear PCM with sampling rate 16000HZ.
g).16-bit linear PCM with sampling rate 44100HZ.
h).16-bit linear PCM with sampling rate 48000HZ.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android Main menu.
2. Should be available the 8-bit PCM with sampling rates of 8KHZ, 16KHZ,44.1KHZ and 48KHZ PCM/WAVE audio codec files for testing.
3.Should have the 16-bit PCM with sampling rates of 8KHZ, 16KHZ,44.1KHZ and 48KHZ PCM/WAVE audio codec files ready.

step.actions:
1. Copy the 8-bit linear PCM with Sampling rates of 8000 Hz, 16000 Hz, 44100 Hz and 48000 Hz WAVE(.wav) Audio decode format files into the device.  
2. Open the Music Apk.
3. Select and Playback the above copied files from the device and Check whether DUT is playing without any issues or not.
4. Copy the 16-bit linear PCM with Sampling rates of 8000 Hz, 16000 Hz, 44100 Hz and 48000 Hz WAVE(.wav) Audio decode format files into the device.
5. Open the Music Apk.
6. Playback the above copied files from the device and Check whether DUT is playing without any issues or not.
step.expectedresults:
1. The DUT should support the Playback of 8-bit linear PCM with Sampling rates at 8000 Hz, 16000 Hz, 44100 Hz and 48000 Hz WAVE(.wav) Audio decode format files without any issues.
2. The DUT should support the Playback of 16-bit linear PCM with Sampling rates at 8000 Hz, 16000 Hz, 44100 Hz and 48000 Hz WAVE(.wav) Audio decode format files without any issues.

testcase.name: Boot:Check device is booting to android screen
testcase.summary: Verify whether AMD Tambourine Platform is booting to its unlock screen or not..

step.actions:

2. Verify whether AMD Tambourine platform is able to boot completely to device unlock screen or not.
step.expectedresults: After switch on the Power button, the AMD Tambourine platform should be booting to its unlock screen without any issues.

testcase.name: WiFi:Check WiFi option enable/disable
testcase.summary: Verify WiFi option enabling/disabling functionality
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Wi-Fi functionality should be supported in the build
3. WiFi module should be present on device.

step.actions:
1. Go to Settings->Wireless & networks->Wi-Fi settings
2. Enable WiFi option and verify whether WiFi option is ON or not.
3. Disable WiFi option and check whether WiFi is OFF or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. WiFi should be ON when WiFi option is checked and WiFi should be off when the WiFi option is unchecked.

testcase.name: BT:Check BlueTooth option enable/disable functionality
testcase.summary: Verify Turn ON/OFF of Bluetooth functionality
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. BT h/w module should be present on the device

step.actions:
1. Go to settings > wireless & networks > Bluetooth 
2. Turn On Bluetooth. Verify whether it is turned ON or not. 
3. Turn OFF Bluetooth. Check whether it is turned OFF or not
step.expectedresults: 1. BT should be turned ON when enabling the BT option and it should be turned OFF when the BT option is unchecked

testcase.name: Multimedia:Check JPEG decode functionality
testcase.summary: Verify whether DUT is supporting the JPEG image decode format or not:
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot the DUT up to Android Main menu.
2. The JPEG image format should be available for testing.

step.actions:
1. Copy the image of JPEG format into the device.
2. Open Gallery Apk.
2. Open the above copied image from the device and check whether image is clearly visible or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. The image of JPEG formate file should be open and show without any issues.

testcase.name: Multimedia:Check H263 video codec with 3GPP container
testcase.summary: Verify whether DUT is supporting the H.263 Video codec format with the 3GPP(.3gp) container files or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot the DUT up to Android Main menu.
2. The H.263 video codec supported files of .3gp container should be available for testing.

step.actions:
1. Copy the H.263 video codec supported of the .3gp container files into the device.
2. Open the Gallery Apk.
3. Select and Playback the above copied files from the device and check whether they are playing without any issues or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. The device should playback the H.263 video codec supported of the .3gp container files without any issues.

testcase.name: Multimedia:Check Audeo decode functionality of .mp3 format
testcase.summary: Verify whether the DUT is supporting the Playback of MP3(.mp3) Audio format or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Boot DUT up to Android Main menu.
2. Should be available the MP3(.mp3) audio codec format file.

step.actions:
1. Copy the MP3(.mp3) Audio decode format file into the device.
2. Open the Music Apk.
3. Select and Playback the above copied file from the device and Check whether DUT is playback the file without any issues or not.
step.expectedresults: 1.The DUT should playback the MP3(.mp3) Audio format file without any issues.

testcase.name: OtherConnectivity:Check Airplane mode option enable/disable functionality
testcase.summary: Verify whether system is able to enable and disable Airplane mode or not.
testcase.preconditions: 1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu

step.actions:
1. Goto settings.
2. Goto wireless & network settings → More.
3. Check whether system is able to enable the Airplane option or not. And also check whether able to disable the Airplane option or not.
step.expectedresults: 1. Should be able to enable/disable the Airplane option.

testcase.name: OtherConnectivity:Check browse with URLs
testcase.summary: Verify whether the DUT is able to browse web sites using URL's or not.
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android Main menu
2. The  DUT should have the internet facility (Wi-Fi / 3G / Ethernet)

step.actions:
1.Open the Browser Apk,
2. Open the “www.msn.com” URL.
3. Check whether the MSN website open or not
step.expectedresults: The DUT should be able to browse web sites using URL's and able to access the “www.msn.com” website.

testcase.name: Camera:Check able to capture an image
testcase.summary: Check whether Camera is able to capture image
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Camera functionality should be supported in the build

step.actions: 1 Select camera icon available in home screen 2.Try to capture the image in Normal mode.       3.Check whether proper image is captured and stored in the respective folder in sdcard.
step.expectedresults: Image should be captured and stored in the respective folder in sdcard.

testcase.name: Camera:Check video recording functionality
testcase.summary: Check whether Camera supports video recording feature
testcase.preconditions:
1. DUT should boot up to Android main menu
2. Camera functionality should be supported in the build

step.actions:
1 Select camera icon available in home screen
2.Select video recording option and try recording video of the objects.                                  
3.Check whether proper video is recorded and stored in the respective folder in sdcard.
step.expectedresults: Image of distant objects should be captured properly and stored in the respective folder in sdcard.

testcase.name: 20190617-14:23:58 USB:Check USB storage detection
testcase.summary: Check the USB Storage device Functionality
testcase.preconditions:
1. OS should installed properly on the device with out any issues.
3. USB should work as a host.

step.actions:
1. Connect a USB storage device (e.g.: USB 2.0/3.0 Flash device/Pen drives) to USB host port.
2. Go to settings -> Storage -> USB disk.
3. Now check whether USB 2.0 flash device is detected or not with out any issues. .
step.expectedresults: 1. USB Storage should detect in USB host port and also device display screen should not rotate when the USB 2.0 devices connected to host port.USb storage device data should display properly without any issues.

testcase.name: 20190617-14:25:06 Ethernet:Check Ethernet detection
testcase.summary: Check the Ethernet detection functionality.
testcase.preconditions:
1. Build should support Ethernet.
2. Ethernet cable should be available and it has Internet connection.
3. Boot the DUT completely to its unlock screen.
4. Connect Ethernet Cable to the Raven Board Ethernet port.

step.actions: 1. Check whether Ethernet cable is detected or not by looking at the Ethernet port. If the cable is detected  then LED light will blink at the port.
step.expectedresults: The Ethernet cable should detect
